text: Falling snow drifts upon the Mansard rooftop of a large, isolated, and decrepit New England colonial. Paned windows in the gables are cracked and broken. Worn stone steps lead to a rotting open porch. An equally ragged '48 Chevy Aerosedan sits in the driveway. Behind the house lies a void of evergreen and leafless birch. Far down the road, lies a lone neighborhood house. There are only two houses on this street. Here, Christmas lights are strung, but many of the fat bulbs are burned out. The building appears like a haunted house on Christmas Eve. The windows are dark, except for a pale blue light in the living room..
A reflection of a bassinet and an eerie blue light wraps around a silver and gold glass bulb celebrating "Baby's First Christmas - 1970."
BILLY'S FATHER, early 20's, lights a cigarette while hunched at the foot of a second hand bassinet, hooded by worn blankets. A gooseneck office lamp, shining a purplish light, arcs over the crib...
Across the lid of a well worn lighter: Khe Sanh '67-'68. On the base: PVT. LENZ. FRANK is above a Marine Corp Chesty Bulldog and an inscription: "Not afraid, just lonely."

Lifts his eyes, lined with dark circles, and reaches out to peel back the edge of a blanket, checking inside the bassinet. CAMERA PUSHES PAST the FATHER to the bassinet, MOVING INTO the opening of the blankets to REVEAL the eyes of a newborn. Although not demonic or supernatural, the eyes are unsettling; inhuman. Yellowed with a chronic jaundice, the eyes are much too focused and intense for a newborn.

slumps in the corner of the couch, back to father and son, as if imagining herself as far from them as possible. An empty bottle of Tanqueray sits on the coffee table. She turns toward her husband and child looking at them, blank.  She stands, drunk, and moves toward the Evergleam pink aluminum Christmas tree. The mother reaches out...
"Baby's First Christmas - 1970" is plucked off the tree...
Eyes the father...
Crushes the ornament; glass cutting her skin...
Glares at his wife, then, turns his eyes down to the floor...
Shards of the broken bulb are dotted with blood. Flames from the fireplace are reflected in the shattered glass...
A plate of cookies for Santa ENTERS FRAME...

Billy's mother sits in the corner of the couch, cigarette in one hand, a Screwdriver in a highball glass in the other. The room is lit only by the lights of the Christmas tree. In the b.g., the bassinet is long gone. Billy's father, appearing haggard, helps his five year old son, BILLY, place the plate beneath the pink aluminum Christmas tree. Billy's back is to CAMERA and partially obscured by the tree branches. He wears long sleeve pajamas.
CAMERA IS LOW MOVING TOWARD her as she glares at them with disgust. She appears anxious; jittery. The years have not been good to her, either...
Why you bothering putting with those cookies? Santa ain't comin' to see you.
The young boy turns his head toward her, REVEALING the yellowed irises, staring at her with icy lifelessness.
CAMERA CONTINUES as she smiles cruelly at her own joke...
Russians shot his sleigh down. Santa... Claus... is dead.
His lids subtly flinch as he holds his stare on his mother.
Glares at his wife as he lights a cigarette with the Zippo lighter. He leans down to his son. CAMERA PUSHES IN CLOSE to his lips and Billy's jaundiced ear. The father WHISPERS...
Ease and quickly turn away...
CAMERA IS BEHIND THE BOY as he charges up the darkened stairs.
as she brings the cigarette to her lips, she averts her eyes.
The door swings open. Billy moves directly toward the closet.
A flashlight FLARES INTO CAMERA REVEALING the closet acts as the boy's hidden "fort."

In the corner of the closet is a six inch triangular hole where wood has rotted or been damaged by termites. A space exits between the closet wall and the inner exterior wall. The boy's hand reaches into the hole and removes a gift enwrapped with cheap Christmas paper.
"To Billy. From Santa."
Subtly smile as, 0.S., paper tears...
An Aurora plastic model of the Apollo-Soyuz Mission. The date is marked in the artwork. "July 17, 1975"
Well with tears as he looks down at the closet floor.
chronically jaundiced, move past the model box and holds the gift tag from Santa Claus whom he knows to be his father.

CAMERA IS LOW to the floor as it moves toward the closet door, slightly ajar. Outside, a winter wind HOWLS As CAMERA REACHES THE CLOSET the argument is broken by a TOPPLING of a NIGHT STAND. Glass shatters. An adult male MOANS; another. Then, abruptly... SILENCE. In the darkness of the closet, Billy's yellow eyes appear, looking out as if listening with his sense of sight.

CAMERA REMAINS LOW to the ground CREEPING DOWN THE HALLWAY as Billy, thin and spidery, crawls cautiously toward his parents' bedroom door. Once there, he lowers his head and places his face flush against the worn carpet to look beneath the door.
One of Billy's yellowed eyes peers into the room...

His mother's bare feet stand on the carpet beside a blood stained clawed hammer and a large green Hefty lawn trash bag. His father's body lies dead on the floor.  10 11 Another pair of male shoes, those of his mother's LOVER, ENTER FRAME. The bag is picked up the bag. As it SNAPS OPEN...
Billy's eyes vanish as he runs off...
The closet door is closed. The room, silent.

Total darkness for a beat... then a faint light appears from the hole in the floor of the closet. Frightened, Billy, his back against the far wall, looks to the hole. Then... deep within the house... more clearly audible from the hole in the closet... a RUSTLE... plastic CRACKLES and DRAGS... strained BREATHS. CAMERA PUSHES TO THE HOLE as Billy leans closer, listens. After a beat, CAMERA ARCS until the HOLE FILLS FRAME. Billy's hand reaches out and pulls at the wood, creating a larger hole. As he tears at the wood...
Under the house, a flashlight shines REVEALING Billy's mother and her LOVER, a fat hairy sweaty man digging a hole in the ground.

The flashlight beam rolls onto the bloodied face of Billy's father, in the plastic bag which has torn from being dragged. His skull has been crushed by a blunt object across the eyes. His Vietnam Zippo lighter has slipped out of his shirt pocket.

blood soaked hair clings to her face as she pulls up dirt. CAMERA PUSHES PAST her toward the base of the far wall... Exhales of human breath jet from the interior of the wall and into the area beneath the house. Climbing down within the wall... Billy's dark figure reaches the surface.  12 13 14 15
Hearing the SOUND, she spins the flashlight beam toward...
Her son's eyes; watching her. Witnessing.
CAMERA PUSHES IN as she starts toward him...
flashlight beam whipping over him, moves back into the wall...
The mother pauses... then races off...
CAMERA LOOKS DOWN THE WALL as the boy begins to scale upwards; awkward and strained, yet motivated by fear...
Billy's mother and lover, covered with wet mud and blood, hustle into the living room. Within the walls... MOVEMENT.
A board is POUNDED, then CRACKS allowing the dark form of the boy to appear over the lip of the floor and into the attic...
A combination lock SNAPS, imprisoning Billy inside the attic.
primordial, breathing hard; eyes, locked on the attic door.

CAMERA MOVES ALONG the attic floor. Half of the area is uncovered and beamed, filled with aging loose-fill rock wool. The floor constructed of wood lathe and plaster. Boxes and furniture have been stored precariously across the beams. A path of wood planks leads to a ten foot area of solid floor. BILLY'S FORM ENTERS FRAME, older now; malnourished. CAMERA PUSHES IN as he sits in a rocking chair at the attic window. Older, now, twelve, or so... and, although, seemingly lifeless, Billy is, in fact, a ticking bomb. O.S., MUTED but discernible grotesque female GRUNTS and SIGHS are HEARD THROUGH THE ATTIC DOOR...

The area is dark and shadowy except for the spill of the fireplace light in the living room below. Billy's Mother is straddled over her heavy sweaty drunken lover who lies on the first landing of the stairway. She is grinding, but he is frustratingly unresponsive. Not dead, just passed out. After a moment, she stops; breathing HARD. She shakes her lover but his response is... unresponsive. She looks at him hatefully. 0.S., in the attic... Billy's ROCKING CHAIR CREAKS. CAMERA PUSHES IN ON HIS MOTHER as her eyes turn upward...

initially, this appears to be the MOTHER'S POV, as the door is partially visible in the dark shadows. CAMERA, however, INCHES BACK just before Billy's mother, bottomless, back to CAMERA, ENTERS FRAME and holds below the door. She looks up. As she moves toward the ladder leading to the attic...
In the darkness... a baby CRIES...
A newborn pink baby, AGNES, lies swaddled in a white wicker bassinet, sleeping beneath a soft amber night light.  19 20 21 22
The couple peer over the crib INTO CAMERA...
She's my family, now. O.S... above... FOOTSTEPS. Billy's mother pauses. With a hard expression, her eyes turns up toward the ceiling. As the cheap overhead chandelier begins to sway...
In the darkness, Tchaikovsky's "Arabian Dance" RISES...

FILL THE FRAME, slashed with noir shadows, only of color, from a string of spare Christmas lights lining the attic wall. CAMERA PULLS BACK, LOW to the FLOOR, REVEALING the spiked tipped legs of a cheap tripod. CAMERA RISES, REVEALING a used Tasco telescope atop the unstable tripod; all in, twenty- five bucks. A bow is stuck on the top along with an envelope.
Billy's step-father and mother climb down the attic ladder. She closes the door and secures the combination lock...
tears open. A Rite-Aid calibre Christmas card displays Santa checking an open scroll with graphics reading, "Be good for goodness sake!" Signed; "Mommy & your step dad."
The telescope ENTERS FRAME and looks out over the 22 neighborhood. Only a few houses with large yards decorated for Christmas populate the area.
A house reflects over Billy's magnified eye...

A family gathers for Christmas appearing like a Norman Rockwell painting. Americana. Warm. Filled with happiness and love. A teenage girl opens a present and reacts, overwhelmed. She moves to her mother and father and gives them a hug.
Once IT FILLS FRAME, the lid opens exposing the yellowed iris...
Lies passed out on the couch, two empty bottles of wine on the floor; a bong on the table. Behind him, a console radio plays, the source of "The Nutcracker"...
eight years old, tears Christmas wrapping off a box revealing a knock off Cabbage Patch doll.

Barefoot, in an worn nightgown, reacts with animated joy, however, as if she has received a gift she's always wanted. As her daughter doesn't match the enthusiasm, however, the mother's expression turns hard. O.S... UPSTAIRS... MOVEMENT. Agnes looks up, curious...
'S that Santa's reindeer? Her mother takes a drink from her highball glass while gathering wrapping paper and stuffing it in a Hefty bag.

There's... nothing... up there. She reaches back and grabs the pack of cigarettes, puts one in her mouth, then feels blindly behind her. She looks back, but cannot find a lighter for her cigarette. Drunk, the mother leans into Agnes with a babying tone...

Want a Christmas cookie? You're my cookie and I could eat you up.  24 25 10. As the mother stands and moves off toward the kitchen, CAMERA CREEPS IN on Agnes. O.S., an ORNAMENT TINKLES. Agnes turns toward the tree...

CAMERA IS MOVING TOWARD a branch rhythmically trembling which causes the ornaments to KNOCK together. CAMERA CONTINUES... INTO THE TREE... TO FIND... behind the tree... a pair of yellow eyes, looking at Agnes.

The counter is littered with Christmas cookies baking material and supplies; baking utensils, flour and sprinkles. She tosses some cookies onto a plate for Agnes, then moves to the stove, ignites a gas burner and lights her cigarette. The phone, a yellowed wall mounted princess phone... RINGS. The mother reacts, curious as to who could be calling. She picks up the phone and before she can answer... a chilling voice emits from the tiny speakers...
She's my family, now. The mother drops the phone. CAMERA LEADS HER OUT of the kitchen as she races toward the living room...
Billy's mother approaches, pausing in the threshold of the kitchen door. CAMERA PUSHES IN AS she takes an anxious step...
Agnes?
Agnes is gone, as is the plastic Hefty bag. The wrapping paper, removed and left on the floor.
looks to her husband...
Billy's step-father awakens from his stoned sleep...  26 27 11.
Anxiously steps into the room and reacts to a sharp pain under her foot. She looks down...
The ripped out eyes of the knock off cabbage patch doll are stuck to the underneath of her foot...
CAMERA now SWEEPS INTO HER. Then, with the timbre heard in the disturbing phone calls...
Bill-lly!
CAMERA IS LOW TO THE GROUND, MOVING RAPIDLY ALONG the hallway as Billy's mother and step-father OUTRACE CAMERA and ENTER FRAME. CAMERA CONTINUES as they run to the attic ladder...
What have you done?! As she climbs, the step-father pauses. Puzzled by...
Remains locked from the outside. The mother's fingers, agitated, frightened, and drunk, fumble with the lock...
What your mother and I must know...
BANGS open!
Is Where did you put the baby? Billy's mother rises into the attic....
Vacant. Billy is nowhere in sight.
Are stunned. Then, 0.S., downstairs, Agnes SCREAMS!  28 29 30 12.
CAMERA IS WIDE as the parents run toward the stairs...
bound down the stairs, CAMERA RISES to Billy's mother...
Billy!? What have you done?!
Billy's shadow clutches Agnes's struggling, choking silhouette; shifting and distorting with the blink of the Christmas tree lights.
turn toward his mother, exposing their yellow tint...
Holds a briloette ornament, blood dripping tip facing out...
opens. An eyeball, iris bright blue, is placed inside...
Charges Billy...
Backlit against the Christmas lights, reaches out for Agnes...
CAMERA SWEEPS TOWARD HER struggling for life, the black plastic Hefty bag over her head... one hole in the bag over her right eye indicating Billy has removed one eye, so far...  31 13.
The Step-father ENTERS FRAME, reaching for Agnes.
THRUSTS the tear shaped ornament outward.
the back of his skull erupts. Dangling at the end of the impaling ornament, with the consistency of an egg yolk, the step father's eye; pushed through the skull. He falls...
TOPPLES! CRASHES! covering Agnes and Billy's step- father...
A string of Christmas tree lights quickly wrap around her neck. Her hands whip to her throat, clutching the cord...
Billy drags his struggling mother into the kitchen...
Billy grabs a rolling pin, coated with flour...

CAMERA INCHES on a plate of freshly baked cookies while, in the dark background, Billy raises the rolling pin above his head. The cookies shake from the unseen impact. CAMERA CONTINUES as the cookies tremble with each THUD...
Billy's hand finds an angel shaped cookie cutter...
The back of her lifeless head lies on the floor. The angel shaped cutter ENTERS FRAME. As it presses to her face...

A silhouette against the glowing red coils inside the oven, Billy ENTERS FRAME with a cookie sheet, dripping blood...  32 33 14. As the oven opens... the hollow radio plays the beautiful flowing harp strings of "The Nutcracker's" "Intrada..."

Silence. After a beat, the front door opens. POLICE OFFICERS, BLUDWORTH and COLQUITT enter, weapons drawn, alarmed, yet cautious. Colquitt moves directly toward the fallen Christmas tree, attending to Agnes. Bludworth continues to the kitchen. Bludworth freezes, expression mortified. CAMERA PULLS BACK REVEALING Billy sitting at the table in the dark; drinking a glass of milk and eating... his Christmas cookies, appearing like shapes of charred jerky with frosting and sprinkles. As Billy calmly finishes his snack, CAMERA CRANES DOWN until the corpse of his mother ENTERS THE F.G...

text: “BLACK CHRISTMAS" Then... a stand up bass with harmonica accents begins a bouncing ball tempo, introducing Mitch Miller and his Orchestra's rendition of "I Saw Mommy Kissing Santa Claus." As the male chorus begins singing, the TITLE CARD FADES...
I saw Mommy kissing Santa Claus...

CLOSE - A PAIR OF EYES —- COMPOSED FAR LEFT OF FRAME A pair of plastic female eyes on an internally illuminated Nativity figure, presumably Mary, appears afraid; trembling in the freezing wind of a Winter storm...
... Underneath the mistletoe last night...  15.
Icy rain streaks past a Magus standing in the snow amongst animals gazing upon a haloed baby in a straw crib beneath His mother and an illuminated angel extending above the tableau.
(CONT'D)
She didn't see me creep down the stairs to have a peep...

head_text.subj: A STRING OF OUTDOOR CHRISTMAS LIGHTS

text: Line the rain gutter of a sorority house. Green, red, and white bulbs shudder and TINK in the storm.
(CONT'D)

She thought that I was tucked up in my bedroom fast asleep... Counter to the storm's threat, GIRLS can be heard, 0O.S., INSIDE, having a PARTY; warm, inviting, plenty of laughter and CLINKING glasses...
The Nativity and the lights decorate the front yard of the New England colonial that was once home to the Lenz family. ACROSS THE LOWER LEFT OF FRAME, A TITLE CARD INDICATES...

The exterior of the house, including the gabled windows and Mansard roof, has been significantly restored in the last twenty-five years, reflecting the money and privilege of the present day occupants. Tonight, pools of color glow in the snow and reflect off the ice from decorative Christmas lights. The interior pulses with a warm amber glow from a fireplace while long thick icicles hang like crystalline fangs from the lip of the roof.

Then, I saw Mommy tickle Santa Claus/Underneath his beard so snowy white... A '66 Pontiac Parisienne tuna boat is parked in the driveway, just before the garage door. Above, gray smoke floats out the chimney, to be whipped by an angry wind.
Greek letters identify the Phi Kappa Sigma sorority.

Inside, a silver and gold Victorian Christmas tree glitters. Discernible behind the tree, a few sorority sisters are drinking, gossiping, and celebrating the Holidays. Now... CAMERA MOVES... not a hand-held wide angle subjective "killer's P.O.V.," but, rather, on TRACKS along the front facade. The MOVEMENT'S texture remains voyeuristic... CAMERA eerily, unexpectedly, begins RISING... toward the second story... REVEALING windows of individual bedrooms.
(CONT'D)

What a laugh it would have been/ if daddy had only seen/Mommy kissing Santa Claus last night! CAMERA TRACKS parallel to the rooms, REVEALING a window in which hangs a small holly wreath with white micro lights. MEGAN HELMS, 23, can be seen pacing angrily while on her cell phone. Although furious with whomever is on the receiving end, Megan is clearly trying to keep her voice DOWN. She pulls the phone away and flips it off before hanging up. CAMERA MOVES PAST HER WINDOW just as Megan sits at her desk before an open laptop and looks sickened, at the monitor. The next room is dark, yet not vacant. Attractive and urban, LAUREN HANNON, 21, leans out over the sill of her open window smoking a cigarette. CAMERA CONTINUES as she shudders at the mounting storm and exhales, somewhat sad, before dropping the butt into a beer bottle. CAMERA CONTINUES TO the next room in which CLAIR CROSBY, 20, appears excited, yet anxious while pacing with a sheet of high quality gift wrapping paper, cellophane tape, ribbons and scissors. As she sits, Clair disappears from view... CAMERA BEGINS RISING... toward the third story, while also PUSHING IN ON a gabled window framed with Christmas lights on the top level of the house. Behind the weathered mutins stands an illuminated plastic Santa Claus. The window is ajar; softly KNOCKING against the sill...  34 35 36 17. From the dim spill of the decorative lights, it is apparent the large area behind the window is not a living space, but, rather, the attic which was once Billy Lenz's room.

Cardboard cartons and furniture are stacked and dusty. Behind these, appearing to rise from the floor and within the wall, streams of strained breaths are visible in the cold. The breathing stops... beat... then... with a startling SCREECH an old rocking chair is placed at the window and released. The vacant chair gently rocks... INT. ATTIC - SORORITY HOUSE - NIGHT - THE KILLER'S P.O.V. WIDE ANGLE and HAND HELD, arrhythmic human breaths jet from behind CAMERA as it CREEPS TOWARD a closed square door in the floor, partially framed by faint light seeping from below.

CAMERA MOVES THROUGH a corridor of dark wood walls and hardwood floors lit with a string of Christmas lights. The sconces are turned off. CAMERA PUSHES past Clair's room and toward a corner of the ceiling at the shadowy end of the hall, REVEALING an attic trap door. The door lifts. CREAKS...
Is PLUCKED from a bottle...

wrapped with tasteful paper and great care sits on the floor amongst scraps of paper and ribbon. The wine cork drops INTO FRAME followed by the CORKSCREW. At this IMAGE SIZE, the corkscrew appears like a threatening auger bit. Thick. Sharp.

Unaware of the presence outside her door, Clair appears mixed with dreaded apprehension and excited anticipation as she opens a blank Christmas card and gathers her thoughts. The first being, her thoughts could use some wine. She pours the Pinot into a glass. OUTSIDE, the storm is a CONSTANT presence.  18.
a couple travel bags are packed, but open. CAMERA INCHES TOWARD her cell phone; red power indicator light blinking...
Hang two dry cleaned outfits, wrapped in clear plastic, appearing like body bags in the closet shadows...
behind Clair; plastic shopping bags and a store wrapped gift.
The tag reads "To: Lauren Fr: Secret Santa."
Enwrapped with different paper; special. The tag reads... "To: My big sister, Leigh. Fr: Her baby sister, Clair."
Is set down beside her, alongside a pair of open scissors. Ominous; a potential tool of murder...
The nub, sharp. Ink; blood red. It is picked up...
Considers...
She writes... "Leigh..."
SIGHS, then takes a long sip of wine...
Is returned to the floor...
the dry cleaning plastic RUSTLES. She turns, startles...  19.
Flutter... the forms appearing like corpses in a morgue...
Composes, smiles at her startle, then looks to...
Air wisps through the heating vent...

takes another sip of wine before her expression conveys she has caught hold of some words for which she has been searching to express complex emotions. She quickly sets down the wine glass and reaches back for the pen...
Clair reaches for the pen, but it is no longer there...
Puzzled, turns a quarter and looks to the floor...
The pen is gone. A shadow approaches...
As she turns to see which of her sorority sisters has entered... a clear plastic bag whips over her head.
Like a vacuum, the plastic CLASPS to her face; mouth wide with horror and pain as she takes her last GASP...
Is THRUST through the bag and into her eye.
As colored shadows struggle over the bed... CAMERA PUSHES IN to REVEAL Clair's cell phone is gone... OVERLAPPING...
Christmas gifts wrapped in holiday paper are rummaged by a pair of female hands...
I don't see Billy's present under the tree, here.
The Phi Kappa Sigma house mother, MRS. MacHENRY, late fifties to early sixties, is on her knees wearing a Santa Claus hat beneath the Christmas tree.
Can't start the secret Santa without Billy's present. Ms. Mac looks to the gathered sorority sisters...

Several hang out on sofas, in chairs, and on the floor. Each with a glass of wine, beer, or a shooter. The sisters are not as into this tradition as the house mother. The interior decor is tasteful and reflects the upper economic class of its members. Comfortable and inviting, the room is warmed by an amber glow from a fire in the hearth. The house feels safe and Christmassy. CAMERA BEGINS CREEPING... ARCING... while the girls LAUGH, buzzed from the alcohol and holiday respite from college.

Who drew Billy's name? HEATHER LEE, 20, a Charleston, South Carolina blonde, not a hair out of place and a touch self righteous, appears uncomfortable with Ms. Mac's search for Billie's present... MELISSA KITT, 20, Asian, sits with her feet propped on the coffee table.
Um... dude... it's a secret Santa. DANA MATHIS, 20, a daddy's girl ice princess, keeps her eyes focused on painting her nails a tasteful Christmas red...
Who cares about him? Can we just get on with this? (MORE)
I've got the red eye to JFK so I can get home and party for a few days before having to deal with family on Christmas.
Red eye? Dude, you ain't goin' anywhere. Look outside. It's raining hail the size of Yao Ming's testicles.
Really?

I know you never watch any news, so, just look outside... Dana sits up on the couch and stretches to look out while KELLI PRESELY, the youngest member of the sorority who is treated like everyone's little sister, pulls aside the curtains for Dana to look outside.
Can't see.
Then, just listen. They listen to the intense rhythmic thumping on the roof. Melissa gestures as if, "well?"
It'll stop. The party gods won't allow me to be here on Christmas break by myself. Melissa laughs and shakes her head as she looks to Kelli...
I'll be here, Dana. They're making me work next week.
Oh yeah, right. Hmmm... let's see... get home and go to Ivanka Trump's Christmas party... or... hang here with you and your townie boyfriend, Kyle, and watch "Monster Garage Christmas." Hmmm...
You have to work? Dude, that sucks. Everyone should be home for Christmas.

Yeah, well, kind of expensive to go home. Just saw my mom and dad at Thanksgiving. And, you know, I never had any sisters or brothers to share Christmas with, so... (to Dana) I'll be your family, now...  22. A touch tone house phone ENTERS FRAME... It RINGS; AMPLIFIED to create a startle...
Want me to treat you like I do my sister? (beat) Get the phone. Kelli moves to the phone and answers...
Phi Kappa... CAMERA CREEPS IN as she reacts, absently tilting her head as if this will help her understand the caller...

What..? Who? (beat) Oh, hey, Darin... you kept breakin' up... Storm's bad where you are, huh? Sorry, she's gone home for Christmas break. Try her cell... Merry Christmas. As Kelli hangs up, a MUTED, RINGTONE plays "JINGLE BELLS." MELISSA lifts her behind and removes a cell phone from her back pocket...
Hello... Hey!
That is so gay. Melissa throws Dana a "like I care what you think" shrug. She believes the ringtone is cheesy cool. So does Kelli who removes her phone...

I have the same phone, but mine plays "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy." She hits a button and the ring tone begins the tinkling introduction of "The Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" as she heads back toward the stairs...
I'm so sad for you.
Doesn't your phone do anything? Dana holds up her Blackberry...
Validates me. Ms. Mac moves away from the tree, flustered.  23.
Who's not here?
Like... everybody.
Chelsea?
Went home, this morning. Melissa hangs up her call...
Greer?
That was her on the phone. She and Erin and Taylor are on that ski trip with with all the A.D.G. guys next door.
Didn't I see Clair, earlier?
Isn't she upstairs writing a card to her sister?
No, I think that, maybe, Clair's sister might've already picked her up. Remember, this is that... “occasion for Clair and her sister and her mom to bury the hatchet and rediscover each other."
I'd like to bury the hatchet with my sister... right in her head.

CAMERA LOOKS OUT THE ATTIC WINDOW. Suddenly! Clair's dead body ROCKS INTO and FILLS FRAME. The clear plastic shopping bag clings to her frozen bloody horrified expression; skull- like as her eye sockets are empty. As the chair slowly rocks... CREAK... CREAK... CREAK...
Ms. Mac sighs, considers, before she calls out to Kelli...
Kelli, can you run upstairs and bring down whoever's up there? As Kelli hustles off toward the stairs...
CAMERA IS MOVING past the blinking Christmas lights in the dark vacant hallway. Lauren exits and steps into the dim hallway as Kelli bounds up the stairs...

We're opening presents. Can you see if Clair's in her room? Lauren turns back down the hall toward Clair's room as Kelli KNOCKS on Megan's door. The response is terse.. what? MEGAN (0.S.) ats Kelli appears concerned by Megan's tone...
Megan... it's Kelli. 41 INT. MEGAN'S ROOM - NIGHT 4l Megan tenses with dread, mouthing "fuck!"
What?
We're gonna open presents, downstairs. Once again, Megan tenses...
Kelli listens by the door...
Start without me.
But, you're going to come down, right?  43 25.
I don't know, Kelli! If I do, I do. Just start without me. Kelli looks up, down the hall toward Lauren.
Reacts incredulous and impatient with Megan's behavior...
I realize you're an only child, so let me explain... Christmas is just Darwin. The weak get eaten. Lauren POUNDS on Clair's door. Then, like a Marine Corp D.I.
We're opening presents, NOW! If you're not down there, your gifts will be mine. Lauren walks away from Clair's door without awaiting a response. She tosses to Kelli...
Kelli sighs with derision at Lauren's method as she passes enroute to the stairway. Kelli TAPS politely on Megan's door.
Megan... you okay?
Yes... no... just... FUCK
Kelli is taken aback. Concerned, she considers knocking again, however, turns and moves off toward the stairs...
Ms. Mac continues rummaging through the presents while Heather remains anxious and somewhat guilty...
Ms. Mac, why don't you open the present we got you?
Billy always gets his present first. Fifteen year Phi Kappa Sigma tradition.  26. In the b.g., Lauren moves down the stairs into the living room, followed by Kelli...
He's gonna be pih-issed, then come back here and eat us. Ms. Mac reacts to the residue smell of cigarettes left in Lauren's wake.
Not as pissed as I'm gonna be if you've been smoking in your room. Lauren shakes her head with feigned innocence as she swipes someone's full glass of red wine and as she takes a sip...
Must've been Billy's ghost.
Don't think he's dead. Is he?
Watches, then sighs, confessional...
Okay, look... I drew "that name."

beneath the tree, Ms. Mac looks to Heather. Lauren pauses mid sip of wine. Dana eyes Melissa, flashes a catty grimace, and mouths "oops." Heather, sitting upright, inches up on the edge of the sofa; posture defensive...
Can I just say... I'm sorry, but, I am very not okay with any of this. I mean, buying a Christmas present for a serial killer?
Serial killers murder repeatedly for sexual thrill. Billy Lenz was a spree killer. Dude just fuckin' lost it!

What-ever. I'm just offended by a... pagan sacrifice... to ward off evil spirits on Christmas. Ms. Mac moves toward the fireplace and picks up a foot and a half long, two pronged barbecue fork. As she sticks a marshmallow on the end and places it over the fire...  27.
Come on, Heather, it's just a bit of fun... Lauren cuts her off...
Christmas is more about warding off evil spirits than Halloween.
At the top of the staircase, looking through the rails of the dark wood banister. CAMERA is INCHING FORWARD, as if the P.O.V. of an unidentified person... watching.
Let it go, Heather. Just be happy you had to buy a present for a serial killer instead of Lauren.
Heather is rattled and not as good at rancorous debate as Lauren, who knows it...
What Christmas shit in this room reflects anything Christian? Huh? The girls pause, then look about the room as Lauren randomly points at various Christmas decorations...
It's all neo-pagan magik. Christmas tree's a magical rite ensuring the return of the crops. Mistletoe is a conception charm...
Then, get it away from me. Kelli smiles. Lauren's momentum picks up...
Fifth century Christians jacked a Roman winter festival. Twelve days in December when the nights were long and the earth was roamed by the demons of chaos.
I saw them, yesterday, at Wal-Mart.  28.

And fuckin' Santa Claus? This voyeur that watches you all year and determines if you've behaved to his standards of decency before breaking into your house in the middle of the night? And that's different from what Billy did, how? Ms. Mac smiles as she pulls a toasted marshmallow off the fork and into her mouth as she returns to the tree...
He didn't break in. Billy lived here.
Large in the f.g., RINGS! LOUD! Startling. Kelli knows she will be called upon and moves toward the phone...
CAMERA RISES with the receiver as Kelli lifts it to her ear...
Phi Kappa. CAMERA CREEPS TOWARD HER...
Hello? She listens, then smirks, bemused...
Need to work on it, Kyle. Then quickly, Kelli grows alarmed. She pulls away from the phone and turns to the other girls...

I think someone's in trouble... She quickly presses the "hold" button, sets the receiver in the cradle and hits the "speaker" button. CAMERA TILTS DOWN to the PHONE which FILLS THE FRAME... The SOUND emitting through the speaker is like the low wailing of a wounded animal, yet with an edge of unsettling perversity. Although not discernibly obscene, it is quite sexually chilling.
The SOUND freezes the girls with collective anxiety. They are absently drawn together; listening...  29.

Yeah, he's in trouble. Dude's whackin' off with egg nog lube. Melissa GIGGLES and begins adding to the joke, until... The PHONE ERUPTS with a nightmarish cacophony of VOICES; women, men, a crying baby. INSANE and DEMONIC; intertwined with one another. GROANS, DISTANT SHRIEKS, CACKLES; it SOUNDS as if a Dore etching of Hell could speak. Meanwhile, Bing Crosby's rendition of "I'll Be Home For Christmas" plays low on the living room C.D. Meant to be comforting, it subliminally adds to the tension... CAMERA SLOWLY CIRCLES the stunned Phi Kappa sisters' FACES listening to the awful SOUNDS emitting from the phone. Then, cutting through the STATIC of eerie VOICES... yet remaining distant... a VOICE... neither male or female, yet an absolutely crone-like cackle...
Bill-ly! What have you done?! The girls are rattled. A MALE VOICE begs...

What your mother and I must know, Billy... is what did you do with the baby? A COARSE, GRAVELLY male voice, intense, insanely lascivious, and yet, mischievous, like an pre-pubescent boy, JUMPS THROUGH the speakers...
Where is Agnes?
.--She's our family, now. An eerie, pathetic and sad child asks...

Hey, shouldn't you get goin'? Don't you have lots of toys to deliver tonight to good little boys and girls? While Melissa LAUGHS, Dana and Ms. Mac gesture for Lauren to hang up. Lauren gestures, as if, "don't worry." The voice lowers an octave with insane intensity and, most chilling, extremely matter of fact...  30.
I'm going to kill you. Heather quickly disconnects. The room turns deathly SILENT. The girls look to one another, rattled...
Call the police.
Puh-lease. Police ain't gonna do shit about one whack job phone call.
Campus security is down to, like, one guy 'til after Christmas.
Campus security? That's probably who just called.
That couldn't have been one person.
What was the caller I.D.? Was it on campus?
Sorry, didn't even look. My brain was on Kyle...
Dial *69.
That just calls him back. Unless there's something you need him to clarify...

head_text.subj: AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRS

text: A figure steps INTO the F.G., remaining at the top of the darkened stairwell... watching the others. Melissa taps some buttons on the phone, Heather returns to the gathered group of girls, remaining angry at Lauren...
You shouldn't provoke someone like that.
reacts, puzzled, while looking at the phone.
Call log says Clair's cell.  31.
The information goes unregistered as everyone is focused on the rising confrontation. Lauren glares at Heather...
What would you know about dealing with anyone other than a NASCAR dad? Heather's eyes flare with anger. She steps aggressively toward Lauren. Kelli places a restraining hand on Heather...
I'm going home. Disgusted, Heather starts toward the stairs...
Yeah, yeah, run to daddy.
Is that a problem? Heather stops, then turns, pointedly, at Lauren...
Least my family wants me to come home. From Lauren's reaction, Heather has gone straight for the heart and scored a bull's-eye. The other girls know it...
Guys, c'mon... it's, like, Christmas time. Desperate to break the increasing tension, Ms. Mac returns to the idea of Christmas cheer...
Yeah. Heather, what about your present?
Give it to Billy. The figure steps directly in front of Heather, who stops cold.

In sorority terms, EVE GUARALDI, 23, is a "mistake." A quiet girl whom events in her life could have caused her either to blossom into a social butterfly or a sullen creepy misfit. The latter is the case. The lenses of her glasses are thick, suggesting a past injury rather than merely vision dysfunction. Eve's physical features could pass for an adult Agnes.  32. Wearing a coat and duffel bag over her shoulder, Eve appears ready to leave. She extends a present, wrapped in newspaper, to Heather.
Merry Christmas, Heather. As Eve looks up and smiles... CAMERA INCHES IN... unnerving.
Merry Christmas, everyone. (beat) You're all, like... my family, now.
Heather looks to Kelli, acknowledging the similarity of Eve's statement with the last comment made during the phone call. Heather forces a smile and takes the present without looking at Eve.
That's... so sweet, Eve.
The newspaper tears away REVEALING a piece of bric-a- brac; a glass unicorn. The horn is six inches long and sharp.
Don't quite know what to make of Eve's tacky gift...
I know you like the Bible 'n' stuff. The others exchange "She is so weird" glances. Ms. Mac seizes upon the gift exchange goodwill, albeit a creepy one, to get things back to a lighter mood...
That's the Christmas spirit! Come on, let's keep it rolling.
Heather continues up the stairs while Eve starts down, averting her eyes, as if sad and troubled as Heather passes...
Eve continues through the living room while Ms. Mac hands out presents from under the tree...  44 45 33.
Melissa... Here, Dana. Is Megan coming down? Let me find yours, Eve...

CAMERA FOLLOWS EVE toward the front door. She pauses near the tree. CAMERA INCHES IN ON EVE as she turns back one quarter, ambiguous as to if she's interested in her present or checking if anyone is watching her...

Megan sits at her desk, balled up; feet on the chair, arms hugging her knees. Her eyes are red from crying as she stares at her open laptop screen which is AWAY FROM CAMERA; the specifics on the monitor cannot be seen.
The girls tear off the wrapping and react with proper warm smiles and appreciation...
I don't see one for Lauren.
Just give her a tequila shot, wish her "Happy Holidays," and she's good to go. Lauren smiles, agrees...
Eve, is Lauren's present under the tree? Ms. Mac turns to check Eve, then reacts, puzzled...
The area in which Eve paused at the tree, is vacant...
(CONT'D)
What, did she leave, already? She just kind of snuck out.
The girls look around. Not spotting Eve on a perfunctory glance, they shrug.
Did Eve have someplace to be?  46 47 34.
The Island of Misfit Toys.
Her mother is a legacy.
And? Her mother's dead. She'd never know if we threw her out. Father's... wherever. No boyfriend. No family. Like, where does she have to go?
CAMERA IS IN MOTION... along the front of the house through the freezing rain driven by howling winds. The movement reflecting the P.O.V. of a hurried, intense, individual.
Melissa takes pity on Lauren who sits with a glass of wine and no Christmas present...
Hey, I understand this is a "secret Santa" thing, but, I know Clair drew your name.
She get me anything good?
A music box. Lauren winces...
Kelli, can you go see if it's in her room? Kelli starts toward the stairs...
Hey, Mel... um... this music box deal? Is there, like, a cigarette inside it, or anything?
Plays "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy."  48 49
Oh, hell no! But Kelli starts up the stairs. Lauren sighs, drunken...
I'm startin' to see sugar plum fairies, I don't need to hear the little fuckers, too.

CAMERA MOVES ALONG the base of the house, then TILTS up along a lattice, covered with bare Winter vines, running the height of the house seemingly to Megan's second level window with the small holly wreath and white micro lights, yet, also, the plastic Santa stands entry just above in the attic window. A gloved hand reaches out and takes hold of the lattice. CAMERA RISES, as the unseen figure begins to climb...

CAMERA IS LOW, near the floor and obliquely angled; 49PT voyeuristic. The texture within THE FRAME is grainy and coarse. A bed is in the b.g., the lighting is low. Visible IN FRAME, a poster of "Alex de Large," Malcolm McDowell in "Clockwork Orange," false eyelash accentuating his maniacal eye, is set directly over the bed with clear push pins. Megan ENTERS FRAME and sits on the bed... CAMERA BEGINS PULLING BACK REVEALING CAMERA has actually been watching Megan's laptop monitor. An Quicktime file plays beside a fileshare website entitled: EYEJACK. The name of the file is... "CLEMENT UNIVERSITY BITCH IN
CAMERA PANS OFF THE MONITOR just as a MALE FIGURE ENTERS FRAME. Megan's VOICE emits from the speakers but it is unintelligible. But, the male's response is clear...
How's she ever gonna find out, ‘less one of us tells her? CAMERA PANS ACROSS the dark room FINDING Megan at her desk, crying, ashamed and angry.
The boy turns over onto his back REVEALING KYLE AUTRY, mid twenties. As he begins unbuttoning his jeans...
Shuts her eyes, intense with regret. O.S., a subtle THUMP; location, indiscernible. On reflex, Megan stops the media player. She holds, listens; afraid of being busted.
As the climber's foot steps on the lattice, the woods BREAKS.
Megan reacts to the 0.S. SOUND, stretching toward her window to look out at the source... until FOOTSTEPS APPROACH and she stops, turns looks toward her door...
Red and green light spills from the hall beneath the closed doorway. The colors turn to shadows as feet pass...
Holds, listens. O.S., a muted KNOCK. KNOCK. KNOCK.
Clair?
Kelli knocks at a door two rooms down from Megan's...
Clair? She listens, then, as she cautiously turns the doorknob...
The gloved hand reaches INTO FRAME and grabs the wood...
Kelli's darkened figure stands in the threshold.
Clair? It's Kelli. You in here?

Megan listens to Kelli's MUTED VOICE. 0.S., another THUMP. O.S... the MUTED tinkle of a music box playing "DANCE OF THE SUGAR PLUM FAIRY" begins. Megan holds, listening to locate its origin. Then, as suddenly as it began... the MUSIC stops.
Clair's door opens. Kelli exits, her figure dark in the hallway. She turns and starts toward the stairs...
Kelli's feet create shadows as they pass...

Waits for Kelli to move off, then returns to the window... The MUSIC starts, again. Puzzled, Megan listens. She moves away from the window and toward the center of the room. The ghostly SOUND seems to emanate from within the wall. The MUSIC begins travelling, up the wall and to the ceiling.
CAMERA LOOKS DIRECTLY DOWN on Megan following the MUSIC. As she reaches her door and turns the knob...
Having steadied and composed, the climbing figure begins ascending toward Megan's window...  59 60 61 62 38.

As Megan opens her door, the MUSIC turns silent. She holds in the doorway, listening. Nothing. SILENCE. Then, down the hall... "The Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" begins, again. CAMERA PUSHES INTO MEGAN as she turns toward...
The MUSIC is behind the attic trap door...
Moves toward the dark end of the hallway...
A duffel bag sits on Heather's bed as she packs. Behind her, the local news plays from an internet feed on her laptop...
Ice accumulations are expected to be three to four inches in most areas. Again... in most areas.
Kelli returns to the living room. She shrugs as she sits...
Couldn't find it.
Damn! If I don't hear "The Sugar Plum Fairies," I'll just die! OVERLAPPING... the afore-mentioned MUSIC begins...
Megan steps INTO FRAME looking up...
Lit only by Christmas lights at the opposite end of the hall.  63 64 65 39.
not afraid, but quite curious. The crystalline MUSIC continues. Megan reaches out and grasps a rung on the wood ladder. She begins climbing...

The open window TAPS from the wind. Spill light from the illuminated plastic Santa in the window brings a dim red cast to the usually pitch black room. The trap door opens. Megan rises into the attic, her breath exhaust can be seen in the cold. The MUSIC BOX sounds clean; definitely in this room.
A tiny ballerina twirls within an open box, reflecting glass and rhinestone. DOWNSTAIRS, O.S., a RAUCOUS LAUGH ERUPTS...
Dana wiggles a Jeff Stryker silicon dildo. She eyes Lauren...
Hmm. Wonder who drew my name? As Lauren smirks and raises her glass in a toast...
"Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" warbles; SLOWING...
turn from the figurine and into the red light tinted room...
Alright... who's fucking with me? O.S., CREAK... CREAK... CREAK. CAMERA PUSHES IN ON HER...
A dark figure, silhouetted against the illuminated Santa Claus, rocks in the creaking chair...  66 40.
remaining with only her head and shoulders through the attic trapdoor, she absently leans closer for a better look...

Clair..? What are you doing? From the darkness, a Hefty trash bag WHIPS over Megan's head. The FRAME TURNS BLACK, as if having CUT TO BLACK, however, MEGAN'S HORRIFIED BREATHS remain amplified and intensely PRESENT. Then, a sickening THRUST RIPS a hole in the bag... A tear erupts in the upper corner of FRAME, exposing the back of the illuminated plastic Santa. ANOTHER THRUST! RIP! A second tear slashes ACROSS FRAME... THRASHING, CAMERA, through the two puncture holes, CATCHES flashes of the killer's legs... macabre sparkles of tinsel... the posed dead body of Clair placed in the rocking chair... The silhouetted killer reaches out as if holding Megan still. The other arm cocks backward with a clawed hammer and slings toward the bag...

head_text.subj: THE ILLUMINATED SANTA CLAUS IN THE WINDOW

text: Is spackled with blood.
pauses, as if reacting to the subtle THUMP of the closing attic door, however, she is actually considering the news...

Wireless services report several microwave relay stations are off- line. Now, a relay station sends calls out of the area, so, that is why, your cell may work on local calls, but not long distance... As she sighs, LAUGHTER ERUPTS from the living room...  67 41.
Ms. Mac sheepishly displays Victoria's Secret lingerie against her body. The drunken girls APPLAUD and LAUGH while Ms. Mac playfully looks inside the gift box...
Does it come with a man to wear it for? More LAUGHS, until Kelli, concerned Ms. Mac may think the joke present is actually the Christmas gift, moves to the tree and searches for another wrapped box.

Here's our real present. She grabs a professionally decorated present and as she hands it to Ms. Mac... the house phone RINGS. Everyone tenses. Melissa moves cautiously toward the phone and checks the caller I.D... MELISSA'S POV - CALLER I.D. Megan Helms.
Melissa smiles nervously and breathes a sigh of relief...
It's just Megan. As she hits the speaker phone button...
Where are you? Her question is cut off by a horrific SCREAM above a tormented cackle....
Billl-ly!! Everyone freezes. Shocked. Horrified.
(CONT'D)
Within the call, a heartbroken wail. Suddenly an older male, voice coarse from cigarettes and whiskey, intensely WHISPERS.
What I must know is... where did you put the baby?  68 69 70 42. Kelli looks to the others and mouths a sincere "Fu-hck!" From the phone, a harsher, commanding tone...
Where did you put Agnes, Billy? Then, present during the first call, but much more pronounced... an eerie man-child voice...
They're my family, now. Upon reflex, Melissa cuts off the call. The CRACKLE of the FIRE is the only SOUND. Kelli breaks the SILENCE as she starts toward the stairs...
What is up Megan's butt, anyway? Melissa and taps a speed dial button.
That was not Megan. She sighs upon receiving a recording...
You have reached the main menu of Clement University campus security. During the Christmas break, our office will be closed from six p.m. December 21st until nine a.m. December 26...
Exits her room, closes the door, and starts down the dark hallway. CAMERA HOLDS on the attic door as she PASSES FRAME...
Kelli hustles up the stairs...
Megan?
Heather continues toward the stairway as Kelli passes...
Megan in her room?
I don't know. I was packing.  71 72 43. Kelli opens Megan's door and is startled by a dark figure. Kelli and Heather SCREAM!
The SCREAMS can be HEARD downstairs. The girls and Ms. Mac immediately race toward the stairs. Lauren stands, but drunkenly swoons, before moving toward the stairs.

Stepping nervously out of the shadows and into the dim hallway light, wearing the climber's gloves, is the boy in the video with Megan KYLE AUTRY, mid twenties. Although lacking the polish of a frat brother, Kyle is no dope. He's bad boy handsome; blue collar smarts. In the b.g., Megan's window is closed. Kelli reacts, puzzled, while Heather catches her breath...
Kyle? What are you doing in there? He appears rattled, eyes Heather, then leans in and to whispers rapidly to Kelli...

I wanted to spend the night with you and I knew that mama son and your "sisters" would kick me out, so I was tryin' to sneak into your room, but, the window wasn't open. I saw Megan's was and it was dark, so I figured she was gone and I climbed up to get to your room. Kelli smiles, touched and believing. Her sorority sisters appear at the top of the stairs and take in the situation...
Is Megan in there?
I don't know. As Kelli moves toward the doorknob, Kyle subtly blocks her.
You climbed up into in her room and you don't know if she's in it?
It's dark.  73 74

You think we're fuckin' stupid? You were in Megan's room. The call just came from from Megan's cell. Unaware of the recent phone calls, Kyle assumes this is an accusation of infidelity and tenses, acts innocent...
What call? The girls remain suspicious. With Kyle distracted, Kelli reaches out, turns the knob, and moves past Kyle. He tenses, but realizes restraining her would look bad...

Megan's laptop sits on her desk in the f.g., turned toward CAMERA and AWAY from the door. A paused image of Megan and Kyle having sex is frozen on the website. Kelli turns on a light. Megan is nowhere to be seen. Kelli moves toward the open closet and peeks inside. Filled with clothes, but no Megan...
Kyle keeps a cautious eye on Kelli inside the room while Lauren keeps a suspicious eye on Kyle...
Can I just say, I'm sorry, but that call was not Megan or Kyle. That was the fucking devil. And they weren't talking to us. They were talking to Billy. A beat of tension, no one denies this...
Billy? Billy Lenz, the guy that lived in this house? Melissa nods.
Well, then, you're definitely gettin' punked, ‘cause he's dead.
Creep-y. Creep-y. Creep-y!  75

Kelli starts toward Megan's desk. Just as she reaches the desk, the screensaver kicks in. The monitor turns black while a winged eyeball flies around the screen. Kelli searches the desk for Megan's cell, but it is not in sight. She closes the open window, while looking outside...

HAIL and SLEET rain violently upon the house, shrouding the Christmas lights and icicles, which have doubled in size. Accumulated ice causes a branch to SPLIT from the trunk of an oak tree. It hangs precariously over the street...
As she twists the window lock...
Lauren's eyes burn a hole in Kyle. Her tone, accusatory...
Where did you hear that he's dead?
Where have you been that you didn't?
Oh, yeah, you're right. Billy Lenz is my life. Kyle eyes her with resentment and dislike...

You spoiled bitches come here for a couple of years, then leave, I grew up here. I stay here. I played on this street before they turned 'em into Frat houses. This was the house that scared the shit out of us... (pointed to Lauren) My whole life.
What happened to him? How'd he die? As CAMERA INCHES INTO KYLE... as he tells the following as if around a campfire on Christmas Eve...  77 78 79 46.
You mean, after he washed down his Christmas cookies with a glass of milk?
CAMERA MOVES ALONG a decrepit institution....
Billy was declared insane. Sent him away to the Clark sanitarium.
CAMERA MATCHES THE SPEED OF THE PREVIOUS MOVE... then TURNS into a doorway to find a figure sitting in a rocking chair in the dark, presumably Billy...

Paramedics saved his sister, Agnes, but she lost her right eye. All scarred up, her parents dead, brother a fucking psycho, she was sent to an orphanage. Like, what hope did she ever have that a foster family would take her? CAMERA PANS... REVEALING, however, AGNES in a rocking chair. Sixteen years old, but appearing forty. Behind thick black rimmed glasses, her prosthetic eye is cheap and colorless and, therefore, eerie as it stares straight ahead while the natural bright blue eye looks at an object in her lap...
(CONT'D)
They kicked her out when she turned eighteen... No one's seen her since... CAMERA TILTS to Agnes' lap, finding her lovingly stroking the hair of the eye-less knock off Cabbage Patch doll.

CAMERA MOVES ALONG a Hellish prison-like institution; high walls encased by rusty razor wire, while snow falls outside. CAMERA CONTINUES until finding a room, set apart from the others, outlined by a string of colored Christmas lights.  80 81 82 47. Inside, a figure, Billy's silhouette, stands in the window.

Last Christmas Eve, Billy used cleaning fluid and a string of Christmas lights, decorating his cell... to set himself on fire. Suddenly, the lights turn off. Inside, the room erupts with violent orange flame. The figure vanishes within the fire...
(CONT'D)
The fire was so hot, the attendants couldn't open the cell. All that was found of Billy, were ashes.
CAMERA TRACKS ACROSS several unmarked gravestones until STOPPING on one.

And, now, that's his home. Where he'll be spending the rest of his Christmases. Alone, in an unmarked grave in the asylum cemetery. Snow falls gently on Billy's lonely tombstone. After a beat... a form ENTERS and holds over the grave.
HAIL and SLEET rain violently upon the nativity figures now encased with ice which causes their images to appear out of focus. The gusting WIND blows a figure over...
The girls are unnerved by the story. Kyle eyes them, aware of the effect. Outside, the STORM is strong.
They ever find out from him why... he killed his family? Kyle eyes them...
It seemed to him... that's how his family showed their love.  83 84 85 48.
BREAKS and collapses... sounding exactly like a GUNSHOT!
The CRACKING SOUND OVERLAPS. The girls flinch, increasingly anxious; growing afraid...
Just a tree branch. Dana removes a cell phone from her pocket and speed dials...
Well, I have something in common with Billy... I won't be home for Christmas, either. The line BEEP BEEP BEEPS, like a busy signal...

Shit. Daddy is going to be so worried. As she dials, again, downstairs, the front door CLOSES. The girls look at one another as if, "who's that?" Ms. Mac moves to the top of the stairs, followed by Dana

The hallway wall acts as a WIPE as CAMERA APPROACHES the top of the stairs... REVEALING... in the living room... a mysterious figure; BACK to CAMERA, wearing a long dark coat, gloves, and covered head, looking toward the Christmas tree.
The girls tense at the sight of a stranger in the house. With a cautious tone, Ms. Mac calls down the stairs...
Can we help you?

CAMERA PUSHES IN ON the back of the figure's head as it turns toward CAMERA and removes the hood REVEALING a beautiful brunette woman in her early thirties; noir-dark and with an edge of mystery. She is LEIGH CROSBY and doesn't appear very enthused about being here. Her voice is sensual and husky...  86 87 49.
She was supposed to call.
The girls eye one another, uncertain. Suspicious.
CAMERA STOPS as LEIGH is in CLOSE-UP...
I'm Claire's sister. (beat) Where is she?
Their alarm heightens, as Clair is now officially "missing."
Kyle steps halfway into the room, appearing impatient with Kelli as she continues searching Megan's room...
What're you doin'? I almost killed myself trying to be with you. Let's go.
I'm kinda worried about Megan.
Who knows what her deal is? Can we just go to my apartment?

Well, she was kinda weird, before; she was, like, a bitch to me, and that's never happened. Then, we've been getting these weird calls, one from her phone and, now, her window's open, her car is still here, but she's just gone in the middle of this weather? Kelli continues searching. Kyle tenses as he steps further into Megan's room..
Leigh eyes the room with an expression of one returning to a location purposefully blocked from memory. Melissa, Heather, and Dana remain guarded.  88 50.
Never thought I'd be back here.
You're a legacy? What year?
I don't know. '93? '94? I started college, late. Quit it, early. Ms. MacHenry reacts, suspicious...
Really? 93's the year I started as house mother, here. I don't remember...

I mean, this was suppose to be such a big fucking weekend for her and I blew off a trip to Vale with this Cardiologist and I drive all the way over here in this shitty weather? Now, where the fuck is she? The sisters look at one another, unable to answer.
Kelli is at Megan's closet while Kyle, cloaking his anxiety, can't help but pace.
What, exactly, are you looking for?

Like, some note or something that says she's okay. All her stuff is still there. Her car is out there. CAMERA FOLLOWS KELLI as she moves toward the desk and sits in front of the laptop. The winged eyeball continues flying across the dark screen...

Call her cell. CAMERA CONTINUES over Kelli's shoulder as she considers, then removes her own cell phone from her back pocket. CAMERA CONTINUES teasingly TOWARD the laptop... yet... once at the computer, CAMERA unexpectedly CONTINUES MOVING... veering toward the wall which RAKES ACROSS FRAME...

Voice mail...  89 51. CAMERA CONTINUES, then SKEWS, TILTING to the ceiling. CAMERA CROSSES THE CEILING, passing beneath the poster of Malcolm McDowell in "Clockwork Orange" directly over Megan's bed. CAMERA PUSHES TO a clear push-pin tack in the poster's upper left corner. As the pin FILLS FRAME...

Hey, Meg, it's Kell. Just wondering what happened to you and if you're okay and stuff. Call me. I'm on my cell. Bye. Then, from a motionless state... subtly... slightly... the tack begins to move; wiggles, as if being worked from the other side of the ceiling. Then... quietly... it falls.
Put upon, Leigh holds out a wallet toward Ms. Mac who checks the driver's license...
Clair's last name is Crosby. This says Colvin.
Divorce'll be final in March. No one responds. Leigh sighs...
What else you need? Can't tell you any secrets about my sister 'cause I don't really know her. Don't know much else about this place 'cause I fucking hated it. Leigh gestures beneath the tree.

I see Billy still gets his Christmas present. Everyone looks at Heather who recoils, then shakes her head. Ms. Mac appears puzzled as Leigh reaches down and picks up a box wrapped in plain newspaper...
That wasn't there, before.

This is new. It's not for Billy. It's for Phi Kappa... from Billy.  90 91 52. Leigh tears the paper to find an Apollo-Soyuz model box. As she opens it, CAMERA PUSHES IN TO REVEAL its contents... a knock off Cabbage Patch doll; eyes ripped out.
The taunting eyeball screen saver flaps across the monitor...
Although she and Kyle are alone, Kelli lowers her voice...
What if there's something on her computer, an e-mail, or something, that says where she is? Kyle takes an anxious, unconscious step toward her...

You know, I don't feel comfortable... um... whatever... invading... someone's privacy, like that. Try the police again. As she lifts her cell phone... 0.S... a subtle THUMP; outside the house... or... possibly... within the wall. Kelli freezes and looks to Kyle...
What was that? O.S., the WIND and HAIL intensify, overwhelming the ability to discern or locate any subtle sounds...
Eye-less, macabre, and threatening, lies encased in newspaper.
How'd it get under the tree?
The girls keep their distance from the doll. Each, too anxious to sit. Except Lauren, whose eyes are red and unfocused from drinking. She points to Leigh...
She must of put it there. She "found" it.  53.
You're giving me shit when none of you can tell me where my sister is? (beat) Where's her room? The girls eye one another until Melissa sighs and gestures for Leigh to follow...
Upstairs... As Leigh follows Melissa toward the stairs, Heather picks up the newspaper that enwrapped Eve's gift to her...
Lookit, same paper as the present she gave me. Ms. Mac looks at both papers and immediately tenses as she looks at the aged paper which wrapped the gift from Billy.
This newspaper is dated December 25... 1983. She passes the paper off to Melissa who examines it...
Eve lives in Billy's room.
They kept him in the attic.
Before that. Remember? She wanted to move in there. Maybe she's obsessed with him. Melissa sighs, skeptical.
Eve was by the tree before she left. She could've put it there.
No, it wasn't there, even a half hour ago. I'm positive. Heather starts toward the stairs...
I'm going to see if there's any of that old newspaper, or anything, in her room. Heather starts up the stairs...  92 93 54.
The whole thing only freaks us out if we know the Billy story. And none of us really cared. Eve couldn't've known Kyle was going to tell us all about Billy.
But... Kyle did. Heather holds on the stairway as everyone considers...
Kelli listens in the center of the room... while Kyle's anxiety over being caught intensifies. O.S., another THUMP. They both pause. She eyes him...
You know what it is? The attic window is open.
What? Think she's up there?
The light from the hallway stretches across the room upon the wrapping paper and half empty glass of wine as the door opens...
Leigh's eyes take in the decor and Clair's personal effects as if looking at the room of a stranger...
There a boyfriend, something, she could have gone to? Melissa shrugs, then shakes her head, "no."
Clair sticks to herself. It's like her to leave and not tell anyone. But, she'll be back. Leigh picks up the gift, looking at it anxiously; sadly...
"To: My big sister, Leigh. Fr: Her baby sister, Clair."  94 55.
Leigh's eyes remain on the gift...

You know her better than I do. (beat) I'm her half-sister. Twelve years older. Clair was in second grade when I moved in here. This room. (beat) Weird how, at this age, twelve years seems like nothing. 'N fact, she seems older. She was the one who wanted to bridge that time... finally get to know each other. (softly) While we could... Leigh is unsettled by her choice of words...
While we can. (beat ) She must have had second thoughts and bailed. Leigh begins unwrapping the paper until Melissa stops her...
No... wait 'til she gets back. Leigh forces a cautious smile and places the gift in her pocket...
Dana, Heather, Lauren and Ms. Mac weigh their suspicions about Kyle...
Kyle was in Megan's room. That last call came from Megan's cell. What more do you want?
Kyle... did... tell that story like we were at a campfire.
And he grew up in town.
What's that got to do with it?  95
He's not one of us. Heather starts up the stairs, again...
Either is Eve. Suddenly, Lauren VOMITS on the coffee table. As the girls leap back...
While, the living room breaks into COMMOTION, Kelli, near the desk, has the window open and is trying to look out and up toward the attic. The weather impedes her view...
Can't tell.

I'm tellin' you, it's the window. Let's go to the attic and I'll close it. Heather passes Megan's open doorway enroute to Eve's room. Then... suddenly... the power decreases fifty percent; like a brown out. Kyle instinctively looks to the lights...
Pulls away from the window and turns toward the room. The corner of her eye catches...
The surge causes the computer to switch to battery power, the screen saver vanishes REVEALING a frozen website image of Kyle on Megan's bed having sex.
As CAMERA SWEEPS IN on her reaction of shock and anger... all the electrical power in the house goes out...
Dana and Ms. Mac help Lauren up the dark stairs. Orange fireplace light creates long, wavering, macabre shadows.
Heather holds in the hallway just outside Eve's room. She reaches into her pocket, removes her cell, and opens it.  98 99 57. The light from the display acts as a make-shift flashlight.
What was once Billy's bedroom door is lit with the cold bluish circle of light from Heather's cell. The door opens.
Kyle appears guilty and, somewhat, relieved...
I'm sorry. I'm really sorry, Kelli. You're really different than these other girls...
I don't... what? Did Megan do this to you? Kelli's innocent confusion only makes Kyle feel worse...
No. No, she just found out about this being on the fileshare site, tonight. Kelli considers, her realization is crushing...
Look, that was before you came here. I didn't put it on the net. A guy at work got pissed off at me and stole my tapes...

My... tapes?! How many are there? YOU FUCKING LIAR! I can't believe this person is you. I can't... compute... how you, Kyle, could do such a thing. I never... ever... saw this was in you. I saw you so differently... He averts his eyes, guiltily...
No one is what other people think they are..
Heather moves around Eve's dark room by the light of her cell phone display. She opens some drawers in the bureau and subtly rifles through some underwear and t-shirts.  100 101 58.
She moves toward Eve's desk, searches the surface, then opens a drawer. As she rifles through the spiral notebooks and loose papers...
Melissa and Leigh exit Clair's room, reacting to Kelli's screams while Ms. Mac and Dana hustle Lauren toward the bathroom until blocked by Kelli and Kyle storming into the hallway.

AM I GOING TO SHOW UP ON THERE? Isn't sex enough? You need a little visual trophy to get your thrills? Facing total humiliation before the outnumbering girls, Kyle turns indignant and defensive. He steps toward her, aggressively and violently; temples and eyes flaring, frightening the others...
Kelli begins crying. Ms. Mac moves to her while Melissa holds onto Lauren, who RETCHES, but holds in from puking...
I got her, Ms. Mac... As Melissa moves Lauren past Leigh, Dana Kelli and Kyle as Ms. Mac holds Kelli...
With a startle, the CLOSET DOOR slides open. The contents inside are disheveled...
Shines her cell phone light on the mess and reacts with a disgusted wince at the mess. She crouches and begins rifling through the contents...  59.

As she pushes aside some worn shoes and boxes, an irregular hole is REVEALED in the closet wall. It is as if the hole had once been repaired, yet, someone has found its vulnerable area and once again pulled out the wood. It is, perhaps, half a foot wide and so deep as to see the rotted wood of the support beams on the outer wall. The corner of a box, hidden within the wall protrudes out of the hole...
Reaches toward the hole...

By the light of her cell phone, Heather's hand reaches into the hole. She pulls on the shoebox. It doesn't remove easily. She pulls again. Again. Finally, the box slides from the hiding place. Just at the moment, the box is removed and Heather's dim blue light pans away from the hole to the box... the light catches a teasing hint of movement within the wall. As if a figure is rising up to watch her...
Opens the box and removes computer print outs and photocopied newspaper reports. She holds her cell to the sheets of paper...
eerie in the cold cell phone light, a collection of reports regarding Billy's massacre twenty-five years ago.
Sickened, digs deeper into the box, removing some papers, she slightly SCREAMS...
The detached eyes of a doll look up at her...
As CAMERA PUSHES IN to her reaction of shock, her cellphone BEEPS, a warning that her battery is about to die. As the cell light goes out and Heather is cast into darkness...
Kyle takes a step toward the stairs to leave, then pauses and eyes Kelli...
I'm sorry, Kelli. I like you so much. I don't blame you for hating my guts but... I wasn't dealing or knocking over 7-1ls. I didn't hurt anybody.
I'll email you a Quicktime of her crying herself to sleep.
Fuck all you bitches.
Leave, Kyle. Kyle starts down the hall toward the stairs. He can't move as fast as he'd like because of the darkness... The house mother holds Kelli, comforting her, as do Kelli's sorority sisters.

The room is dark. The door opens, adding a bit of light. Melissa guides Lauren to her knees over the toilet basin. Lauren holds in that position as Melissa moves to the counter, feels for some matches, and begins lighting candles.

CAMERA IS BEHIND HER, ON the FLOOR as she vomits. An amber glow fills the room. Lauren's vomiting is intense. Her toes curl against the floor of old black and white octagon tiles. As her toe inadvertently flips one loose...
While Ms. Mac and Dana comfort Kelli in the b.g. Leigh looks out the window, puzzled. O.S., DOWNSTAIRS Kyle marches across the living room and SLAMS the door.
Kyle storms out of the house and into the storm, charging across the front yard.
Dana moves to the desk and looks at the laptop. She closes the lid, disgusted with Kyle.
How fucked up was that? Leigh gestures out the window...
How fucked up is it that the only other house on this street has power... and this one doesn't?
Outside, the streetlights are on. The frat house down the road, although for the most part, dark and vacant, indeed displays functioning exterior Christmas lights.
As they look to one another...
Even in the candle light, Lauren is pale and clammy as she sits back on her haunches and catches her breath.
Mel... you're a better sister to me than my sister... Aware Lauren's sentiments derive from intoxication, Melissa smiles...
Dick fucking Cheney's a better sister to you than your sister.
You know what I'm sayin'...

I feel the same way ‘bout you, Lauren, but... you reek, dude. You need a shower. Can you handle it?  62. Lauren nods. Melissa helps Lauren pull off her vomit stained shirt and tosses it aside, then lifts Lauren to her feet. As they unfasten Lauren's jeans, Lauren wobbles, then grimaces. Having stepped on something, Lauren looks to the floor...
Lauren lifts her foot. She has stepped on the loose tile.
Squats and picks up the tile; tests several others. She studies the bad condition of the floor, sighs, and stands...
the tile CLACKS as Melissa tosses it on the counter...
Lauren removes her bra, then begins pulling down her jeans...
I'll go put a trash can next to your bed.

She lifts a foot and pulls off her jeans, then the other foot. Lauren kicks off her pants and steps OUT OF FRAME toward the shower... REVEALING... beneath the floor... in the octagonal hole from the displaced tile... a yellow eye.
Encircled by a dark frame, Lauren is partially obscured as she head under the cold stream..
Recedes into the darkness beneath the floor...

head_text.subj: CAMERA IS JUST OUTSIDE THE SHOWER STALL, A FEW DEGREES

text: ABOVE the floor. After several beats... a tile... closer to CAMERA and the shower... begins rising... slowly... TAP TAP TAP, until the tile pops out of the floor...
Unobstructed and unaware, stands nearly over CAMERA...  106 107 63.
As they watch her...
A circle of flashlight shines INTO CAMERA as Leigh and Dana move down old stairs into the basement...
Megan and Clair were upstairs together. I wonder if Megan, like, 'fessed up to Clair and broke down and is hiding in one of the rooms, so she doesn't have to face Kelli. Or whatever.
I'll check the rooms after we get the lights on. My first thought was Kyle turned ‘em off but, he was in the house when they went out.
Eve wasn't. Leigh finds the fuse box, opens the metal door and resets a circuit breaker...
Are underlit by the flashlight. The power does not return...
Main breaker's under the house. Leigh looks to Dana, uncertain. Dana reacts, defensive.
You know, I'm not the totally hopeless daddy's girl princess these bitches make me out to be.
Is grabbed...
As she dries off, the bathroom door OPENS and Melissa returns.
You okay?  108 109 64.
Stops before the hole. The eye retreats into the darkness. CAMERA, however, DIVES TOWARD and ENTERS the hole... At floor level, the heavily MUTED voices of LEIGH and DANA can be HEARD...
I'll go out. I know where it is. Then we can, at least, turn the alarm on.
I'll go with you.

CAMERA CONTINUES through the hole and into an area under the floor... until... HOLDING on a dim, nearly indiscernible human outline, alarmingly skeletal; hair, long and filthy with partial dreadlocks.

What for? It'll take two seconds. Why should we both freeze our asses off? Go check the rooms. The height between floor and ceiling is, perhaps, twelve inches. There is no room for the figure to maneuver from its back to its stomach. Like a macabre crab, the human form crawls on its back, clearly adept at this unnerving quick arachnidan movement.

CAMERA IS IN THE WALL of the house LOOKING DOWN 25-30 feet as the form appears, limbs outstretched like a spider descending the wall between the support studs and rotted insulation toward the area beneath the house...

Plumbing pipes, rocks, sheets of screen, and discarded rusted tools create a surreal and nightmarish underground. At the base of the wall... bare feet appear, crawling down from within the wall. With no room to turn over, the figure traverses on its back across the dirt base toward the lattice along the porch area...
Melissa guides Lauren, dressed in t-shirt and thong underwear, into her bed. Melissa pulls up the covers...
Dude... there's a trash can, just right here, ‘kay? Lauren MOANS her understanding, then turns and curls into a fetal position.
Merry fucking Christmas.
Ignites, but is whipped violently by the wind...
Sharp icicles cling to the porch overhang. The rain and snow continue falling. As she raises the lighter to the tip of her cigarette, beneath her... MOVEMENT. SCUTTLING.
A drop of water falls...
It hits her cigarette with a bull's-eye, extinguishing it...
Of course. She sighs then looks down, dropping the extinguished butt into a knot hole...
The form SHIFTS, evading the cigarette butt...
Hearing the SHIFT, Dana aims the flashlight into the hole...
A flash... a glint... of an eye... moving out of view.
considers, turns her flashlight on, then proceeds to the porch steps...
MATCHING MOVEMENT WITH Dana's flashlight, a beam cuts ACROSS FRAME as Leigh turns exits a room and turns into the hallway. She continues to the next door and KNOCKS...
Clair? Megan? She opens the door and shines the light. As she CLOSES it and moves on. As her light CROSSES FRAME, again...
Dana moves down the steps. Slipping on the ice and frozen snow, she proceeds toward the side of the porch, kneels to the lattice, and aims her flashlight under the house...
The area is illuminated by the tube of light; nothing but debris; rusted tools, discarded cans, and rotting boxes.
About to abandon the search... Dana holds. CAMERA INCHES IN on her... squinting...
To the side, under the house, rather than the porch... breath exhaust... HUFFS... with a strained rhythm from an unseen person just behind a wall.  120 121 122 123 124 125 67.
moves off toward the rear side of the house...
Leigh moves up the stairs and into the dark hallway. She moves to a door, KNOCKS, and opens it.
She is met by a form. Leigh startles, but the flashlight REVEALS a large plastic Santa Claus head. Eerie in the low angle flashlight.
As Leigh closes the door and moves on...
Fuck you, Santa Claus.
Dana quickly scoots along the side of the house, pausing before a trap door, leading under the house... She tests the door, which pulls out. She crouches; eases her head inside...
Eve, you crazy bitch, I see your breath. WHACK! A 1" diameter lead pipe strikes across the bridge of Dana's nose. Blood squirts. She crumbles.

COVERING any SOUNDS below the house, Heather MARCHES down the stairs into the living room. Kelli is on the couch, crying, seated beside an increasingly anxious Ms. Mac. Leigh pokes at the logs with an improvised tool, milking all the light and heat out of the fire.  126 127 128 68. Kelli takes a drink from any available alcohol on the table as Heather moves to the headless imitation Cabbage Patch doll wrapped in newspaper. She picks it up, then displays Eve's photocopied news stories about Billy.
Found these. (beat) And this. In the wall of the closet. The girls reacts with alarm as Heather opens her palms and displays a pair of doll's eyes...
Dana's limp body extends from the trap door; her head, just inside. Her body drags; stops. Drags; stops. It finally disappears beneath the house.
A FAINT, MUTED, O.S., GROAN causes the girls to pause, listen. They eye one another. Melissa sighs...
There goes Lauren, again.

Face soaked with blood, her eyes flutter; an animal functioning on lizard brain defenses. She pushes her arm forward with all her strength attempting to escape; pulling her body forward with the strength in her arms, as if swimming in a dirt lake.
Holding a rusted 1/2" thick wire support rod, the dark form lays across Dana's legs.
Desperately pull along the dirt. CAMERA MOVES BACK, REVEALING a rusted, pronged, hand cultivator. Dana inches toward it.
Grips the rod, but, before it can swing it toward Dana, she manages to grab the cultivator. She blindly swings her hand backward...  129 69.
The tool plunges above the killer's knee. It reacts, muffling a GROAN OF PAIN. It pulls the prongs from its leg...
pulls her hand back and continues trying to get away...
Dig at the dirt, exposing several teeth of a mummified, decomposed skull previously buried in a shallow grave.

Scuttles ahead of Dana and drives the cultivator into Dana's skull. A prong breaks off from the impact. A sick DULL CRACK and Dana's body turns motionless. Dead. CAMERA INCHES BACK as Dana's murderer, blood stained, exhausted, HUFFS like an animal. CAMERA PUSHES IN as the form moves; left arm extends as the left leg bends, pulls forward, then shifts as the right side repeats the move. Lizard like, the form CLEARS FRAME... As CAMERA TILTS to the ground... a skull FILLS FRAME. An impact fracture splits the skull across the brow. Beside the skull lies a Vietnam Zippo lighter with the name PVT. LENZ. FRANK.
The form reaches up through an open section at the base of the floor and into a vertical space between the walls. Squirming; pulling upward and disappearing OUT OF
Is pulled out of the box; fabric torn. Eyes, empty.
This doll is new.

The fire is nearly dead. Outside, the freezing rain HOWLS and intermittently, the roof is pelted with HAIL. Melissa examines the discovered doll's eyes, then points at the doll found tonight under the tree...  130 131 132 70.
These eyes are aged. They're not from the same doll.
CAMERA is in Eve's room as the door opens and Leigh enters. The girls muted VOICES are barely audible...

What if those are from Agnes' doll? Twenty-five years ago? Eve could've found them. She lives in Billy's old room. The energy in the empty room is unsettling and haunting. Leigh is quick to turn and leave. As she closes the door...
Leigh is at the end of the hallway. She pauses, having run out of rooms. HAIL begins to pummel the roof. Leigh looks up toward the ceiling...
‘Lot of girls have lived in that room, before Eve.
As CAMERA RISES UPWARD...
Outside, the STORM INTENSIFIES... HAIL RIDDLES the ROOF. Heather, Ms. Mac, Melissa, and Kelli are in the dark living room. Their anxiety, intensifying. Delivery, faster, hurried and often whispered.
What if she's the first to get it in her head that she's like him? Doesn't have a family, just like him.
He had a family.
It was pretty random when she said... "we're her family." CAMERA BEGINS TO CREEP... ARCING IN THE ROOM until the house phone ENTERS FRAME...  133 134 71.
Leigh moves under the attic trap door, studying it. As she takes a step onto the first rung...
CAMERA CONTINUES TO ARC... The house PHONE FILLS nearly three quarters of THE FRAME. The girls hold, silhouettes against the window...
Eve was here when we got the calls.
