The calls came from Clair and Megan's cells. They're both missing.
She could have stolen Clair and Megan's cell phones...
But we didn't get a call from Eve.
She doesn't own a cell phone.
(accusatory ) And she didn't disappear. She left. In the b.g., a cell RINGTONE goes off... "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy."
Tense. Kelli eases, then uneasy...
Must be Kyle... She pulls out her cell and checks the caller I.D... KELLI'S CELL PHONE DISPLAY - CALLER I.D. DANA MATHIS CELL.
A raw nerve, Kelli battles to maintain composure... she nearly screams...
Leigh hears Kelli and the others' reaction. Leigh's head turns toward the stairs...
Frightened... Kelli engages the "send" button.
Dana? A witch-like CRY blares from the phone; Billy's mother.
Kelli pulls the phone away, breathing hard. Ms. Mac SCREAMS...
Leigh steps off the ladder and hustles toward the stairs...
The others crowd around, listening. Leigh appears in the background moving down the stairs. What SOUNDS like Billy's step father GROWLS...
What did you do with the baby? Kelli closes her eyes as if that could shut out the sound. Leigh quickly approaches the others...
They're my family, now. The caller disconnects. No DIAL TONE. SILENCE, except for the CRACKLE of the dying fire. CAMERA PUSHES IN ON KELLI, realizing, then alarmed...
Dana!
Crisscrossing flashlight beams backlight a falling sheet of hail and ice as the storm intensifies. Kelli, Melissa, Heather, and Leigh, hustle down the front steps.
Dana?! Dude, where you at? Melissa slips and falls on the treacherous icy surface. The others help her to her feet. Leigh looks over the ground. The girls must shout in the storm...
No footprints. Iced over.

She went around back to the control box. As Melissa, flashlight in hand, and Kelli start off, gingerly, but with haste... CAMERA INCHES INTO HEATHER, flashlight in her hand, looking with suspicion, 0O.S.
An '89 Toyota Corolla with a replaced front end side panel painted primer gray, is parked about fifty feet down the street from the front of the sorority house...
Heather reacts, puzzled and incredulous...
Eve's car. She never left. She moves off. Leigh steps INTO FRAME, annoyed with Heather...
Find Dana, first. Leigh checks Melissa and Kelli, who have advanced along the side of the house. Not wanting anyone to be out here alone, Leigh sighs and starts after Heather...
Kelli and Melissa proceed along the side of the house. In fact, Melissa uses the wall for support...

Dude! Dude!  141 142 143 74. Kelli slips, falling near the trap door in the side of the house. Melissa moves to help, aiming the flashlight on Kelli. Kelli absently places her hand on the frame as a crutch, then looks to Melissa, alarmed. Kelli points to the door. CAMERA SWEEPS toward Kelli's finger pointing to the doorframe marked with Christmas red nail polish scratches...
The driver's side front end of Eve's car FILLS THE FRAME as Heather approaches, followed by Leigh. Heather aims her flashlight toward the Corolla's interior...
Kelli and Melissa are on their hands and knees trying to open the trap door. Kelli quickly looks about the area.
Point the light under the house...
Heather's flashlight beam FLARES INTO CAMERA as she APPROACHES the rear end of Eve's car. The back of a head and shoulders can be seen resting against the driver's window...
As they near the driver's side door...
What is she doing? Sleeping in her car! It's, like, zero degrees... Heather reaches out and pulls up on the doorhandle. Leigh reaches GRABS her hand; a startle.
If she's asleep... (beat) Why aren't the windows fogged? Heather releases the handle, steps back, but, the door opens.
Eve's body, streaked with blood, tumbles TOWARD CAMERA...  144 145 146 75.
Melissa's panning flashlight beam flares INTO CAMERA. O.S., Heather SCREAMS. Kelli and Melissa tear off toward the street.
Leigh hyperventilates beside the car while Heather has moved away, CRYING. Kelli and Melissa approach and see the corpse...
Holy FUCK!
Lies half in and out of the car, her head on the ground REVEALING both eyes have been removed.
CAMERA PUSHES IN as she realizes...
He's out here.
The four women race into the living room and SLAM the
Startles; frightened.
Heather bolts the door while Kelli marches directly to the house phone and picks it up. It's dead. Kelli removes her cell phone, while pacing, dials
Damn it. Kelli continues pacing as she hits re-dial; listens...  76.
shit! As Kelli tries re-dial, again...
What is going on?! Melissa, Heather, and Leigh hesitate, unsure of who should tell Ms. Mac, as well as how to tell her...
Everyone turns toward Kelli as she hits re-dial, yet again...

911 is experiencing heavy caller traffic because of the storm.. All are rattled and anxious. Leigh looks out the front window. Heather and Melissa move from window to window, assuring they are secure.
Why?! What?!
Hello? Yeah... a girl is... dead... outside. Yes, I know her... Eve Guaraldi... Ms. Mac reacts, horrified. She looks to the others...
We're positive she's been murdered...
As CAMERA PUSHES IN on her...
Billy's home for Christmas.
The girls shoot each other anxious glances...
No. No, Ms. Mac. Billy is dead.
(into phone) Three other girls... Kelli looks carefully to Leigh, who, anticipating what Kelli must report...  77.
Are missing... missing.
Are missing... and... what? 566 Oakdale. There's only two houses on the... right... Phi Kappa sorority... Kelli Presley... how long 'til... What?! No! No... She hesitates, reluctant to admit...

We think he's still outside... Would you wait around that long after what I just told you? Upon hearing this, Ms. Mac marches across the room and disappears into a small bedroom off the hallway while Heather, Melissa, and Leigh tense, reacting with dread...
Please, isn't there any way..? (beat)
Kelli hits the "end" button; more afraid than angry...

The storm. Pile-ups all over 91. Reservists can't make it in 'cause the streets are all ice. Trees falling. Power's out everywhere. They... maybe... maybe... can be here... in two hours. Ms. Mac returns wearing her winter coat, carrying her purse and keys in hand...
Well, we'll all be out of here in two minutes. Get your things... Heather approves of the idea and rushes off for her coat.
I'm not going outside. He's outside.
What about Dana?
We'll only go up to the A.D.G. House. Get help.
They've all gone home or skiing.  78.
Whose family lives the closest? Call them.
Lauren's. Her mother lives in Boston.
Even if you could reach her on a cell phone, it'd be at least four or five hours 'til she got here.
And she's in Bermuda with some guy. Melissa reacts, frightened as she suddenly recalls...
Oh, shit! Lauren! Melissa takes off, running for the stairs in the darkness...
Done. Case closed. Let's go!
No! We stay together. We lock up the house, everyone grabs a fireplace poker, or ski pole, or some shit, and for the next two hours, not let each other out of our sights.
No! We'll drive to the police.
In this weather?
Even if they can't do anything. We'll all be safe, there.
We're not all here. If we were, I'd go.

That's right... Unless I see otherwise... I am believing Clair is... alive. And when she comes back... it's not going to be to an empty house. As Leigh moves away, ending the discussion...  147 148 149 79.
CAMERA IS MOVING, LOW TO THE FLOOR as Melissa races up the top of the stairs and down the hall.

The door BURST open! Melissa tenses in the doorway, as she looks 0.S. CAMERA PULLS BACK, REVEALING a motionless mass beneath comforter and sheets... Melissa steadies herself, then inches toward the bed. With dread and fear, she reaches out and grabs a piece of the comforter. She whips off the covers...
Lauren sleeps it off. Drool drips from the corner of her mouth. As Lauren releases a teeth rattling SNORE...
Heather returns wearing her coat, moving directly to the door. Kelli blocks her path, placing her hand on the knob.
Please! We're safer sticking together.
Alright. (beat) Then, get your coats. (calls out)
We're sisters. Act like it. Heather knocks Kelli's hand away and opens the door. The WIND SCREAMS, blowing hail into the entrance. She starts off toward the driveway.
We'll get the police here, fast as we can. Ms. Mac hugs Kelli, then moves off after Heather. CAMERA PUSHES INTO KELLI watching them move toward the driveway...  150 151 152 153 80.
The porch and the front end of the garage obstructs the view of Ms. Mac's car. Only the rear passenger side is in view.
Kelli closes the door, bolts it, and moves toward the stairs, while addressing Leigh...
Can't see the driveway. Maybe from Lauren's room... As Leigh moves from the window, following Kelli...

CAMERA LEADS Ms. Mac and Heather, hustling to the car. Their footsteps CLICK and CRUNCH on the icy surface until Ms. Mac falls. Heather has difficulty with her own footing while helping Ms. Mac to her feet. They manage to proceed toward the driveway REVEALING a dented and dinged '66 Pontiac Parisienne and not in cherry condition. The wheel wells are rusted. Much of this is difficult to discern as the Pontiac is encrusted with ice and snow.
Heather pulls on the door handle, ice CRACKS and STRAINS, but the door is sealed shut by ice. She YANKS harder, then looks around, seeing if anyone is approaching, then YANKS again...
Likewise, Ms. Mac's door is frozen closed. She kicks at the car with her heel. A sheet of ice CRACKS and falls away from the metal. She rushes inside, climbing into the driver's seat.

Ms. Mac inserts the keys into the ignition. In the passenger window, Heather is a silhouette, pulling on the doorhandle, knocking on the window, trying to free the car from ice... The engine won't turn over. Ms. Mac pumps the gas pedal and tries again. The ENGINE STRAINS...  154 155 156 157 81.
C'mon, you piece-a-shit!
key is cranked...
The RADIO COMES TO LIFE... Judy Garland's haunting "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas."
The Pontiac STARTS. Exhaust BELCHES...
Ms. Mac CRANKS the heater and DEFROSTER...
CAMERA INCHES IN OVER Heather's shoulder as she desperately tries opening the door. As she turns back...

The door remains open. Eve's body; in the position it was discovered... HEATHER — LOW ANGLE Reminded of Eve's fate, Heather pulls harder on the door. At this angle, the attic window looms above. Unbeknownst to Heather, Clair's body sits at the window in the rocking chair.
As Heather turns back around, CRACK! A pane of ice SHATTERS! Heather SCREAMS! The door pops open REVEALING Ms. Mac on her back, having kicked the passenger door open with her feet.
Kelli and Leigh enter and move directly to the window. Melissa crosses to the window, as well...
From this vantage, also, only the rear of the Pontiac can be seen. Exhaust pumps from the tail pipe.
Kelli, Leigh, and Melissa eye one another, relieved...
They got the car started.
Heather is now in the passenger seat. She locks the door.

Go! Gol! The front windshield appears opaque from the ice and snow. Ms. Mac tries the wipers, but they strain against the ice. The visibility out the window remains nil. Ms. Mac turns and reaches over the back seat. Incredulous, Heather turns toward the back seat, also...

What are you doing?! While their attention is away from the front of the car... a shadowy form crosses the front end and disappears. Ms. Mac produces an ice scraper, then extends it to Heather as if, "go scrape the ice."
What is that thing? Ms. Mac sighs, turns, and exits the car...
The driver's door remains open as CAMERA ARCS with Ms. Mac around the front end to the windshield. She begins SCRAPING the ice. It is thick and needs plenty of elbow grease.
(muttering) Precious... frigid... princess... southern... privileged... bitch!
160 83. Suddenly... the vehicle rocks... lurches... just once. Ms. Mac pauses, anxious, then continues scraping. Faster.
A piece of ice breaks away creating a three inch diameter window into the front seat. MOTION... a head turns... REVEALING... a yellow eye.
Tenses... frozen with fear...
From the interior, the frosted opaque window suddenly splashes... erupts... with Heather's blood.
Leaping back, hyperventilating, backs into the closed garage door with some force, causing, O.S., a LOUD CRACK!
Several thick stalactite icicles BREAK OFF.
CAMERA RACES TOWARD HER as if a plummeting icicle...
Upon reflex, backed against the garage, Ms. Mac raises her arms shielding herself. It is futile. As her head is impaled and split by the ice dagger...
Outside, the car IDLES. Judy Garland SINGS...
Kelli looks to Melissa and Leigh while Lauren remains dead to the world on her bed...
Should we go out and check on them?
Car's idling. Radio's on.  161
Then... a CELL RINGTONE... "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy." CAMERA PUSHES IN on Kelli and Leigh... scared.
Turns to them, afraid...
As Kelli removes her phone and reads the caller I.D. panel, she stifles a frightened WHIMPER...
BARBARA MacHENRY.
Quickly answers. With desperate hope...
Ms. Mac? The eerie man-child voice declares...
They're my family, now. Kelli abruptly disconnects; tries to be strong, battling frightened tears. Leigh looks at Melissa...
Stay with your friend. Leigh takes Kelli by the arm. As they start out of the room...
race into the kitchen and look out a side window.
This vantage is also partially obscured by the opposite garage wall. The Pontiac driver's side door is open as the vehicle continues IDLING...
Kelli and Leigh struggle to see the entire picture...

Can't tell if they're out there.  162 163 164 165 85. Kelli starts toward another door. CAMERA FOLLOWS as they move to another door off the kitchen. Kelli aims the flashlight at the doorknob and opens the door...
The garage holds no vehicles but, rather, acts as a storage area; cluttered and maze-like.
Stepping into the garage, Leigh looses her footing. Kelli catches her, then shines the flashlight onto the floor.
A puddle of water, created by a leak from above...
Careful. Roof's leaking.
Continue through the boxes, furniture, and old bicycles toward the closed garage door. As they reach the door, Kelli slips, falling to her knees.
Drops. Rolls; REVEALING not a puddle of water, but one of blood, seeping in through the outside at the base of the garage door...
Kelli SCREAMS!
Kelli's SCREAM is deep within the house, but is nonetheless HEARD by Melissa looking out the window to the driveway.
Kelli and Leigh try lifting the garage door...
Ms. Mac's dead body lies slumped against the garage door preventing it from opening. Then... a form ENTERS FRAME... just a shoulder... and HOLDS.  166 167 168 169 86.
Melissa moves to the door and opens it...
Melissa steps into the hallway, looking toward the stairs.
From the darkness behind her, a black plastic bag is whipped over her head. She reaches for her throat, struggles. The plastic vacuums to her face as she GASPS!
Kelli and Leigh desperately push against the garage door...
Feels like... there might be a body blocking it. Then, OUTSIDE, O.S., the Pontiac ENGINE dies. The radio Christmas MUSIC turns SILENT. Someone is out there.

Darkness. O.S., the rhythmic CLICK... CLICK... CLICK... of mechanized winding. Clair's gift to Lauren, the music box, is SET INTO FRAME by a hand with blood stained fingers. The doll turns as "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" begins...
Asleep. Her image is odd, distorted; light bending and refracting colors...
REVEALS CAMERA is looking at Lauren through Eve's gift to Heather, the glass unicorn's horn.
The ornament is clutched by a hand stained with sweat and blood. After a beat... the ornament moves... toward Lauren.  170 171 172 173 87.
The ballerina twirls...
Her image distorts as the horn approaches. Once over her... the ornament pauses. Lauren's eyes open... groggy... drunken. Then, as she looks up and see the figure standing over her...
Hmm. Yeah. Merry Fucking Christmas. Lauren's eyes suddenly flash with horror...

The fire is dead. The room, dark and icy blue. Blood stained and perspiring, even in the cold house, Kelli and Leigh run into the living room from the kitchen. OUTSIDE, a THUMP, THUMP, like heavy footsteps. Kelli looks toward the front window...
A dark figure crosses the porch toward the front door...
As they turn and hustle toward the staircase...
Their urgency intensifies. Kelli bounds up the steps two at a time. Leigh, however, hesitates and quickly reaches out into the living room...
Leigh's hand grabs it. As it's whisked OUT OF FRAME...
Kelli and Leigh tear down the hallway as the POUNDING continues DOWN on the front door...  174 88.

CAMERA PULLS BACK from the threshold as Kelli and Leigh enter REVEALING... Melissa is gone. Lauren, however, remains in bed. One bare foot is out over the side outside of the covers. She lies on her back with her arm, the crook of her inner elbow, over her eyes.
Awww, fuck, no! (calls out)
He'll hear you! Leigh closes the door. She BOLTS the LOCK. Kelli tugs at Lauren's foot, while whispering...
Lauren, where's Mel?! DOWNSTAIRS, a window SHATTERS! Kelli tugs on Lauren's foot...
Where's Mel?! Standing just off to the side of the door, Leigh looks at Kelli. Then whispers, intensely...
Shut up! Leigh clutches the barbecue fork with two hands, turns toward the door and raises it over her head. Ready.
Breathes hard; frightened. She reaches into her pocket and pulls out her cell, fingers trembling as she text messages...
glows with bluish light. She types... "U@?!!" Then, speed dials... MELISSA.
Awaits a response. She kicks at Lauren's foot, waves the flashlight beam across her face...  175 176 89.
O.S... FOOTSTEPS approach...
looks to her phone...
The illuminated display reads: U@?!!
CAMERA BEGINS MOVING DOWN THE HALL, as if a P.O.V. Flashlight seeps from beneath the door inside Lauren's room.
Raises the prongs above her head, readies...
Texts, again. This time... FAINT... MUTED... however, a definitely audible... a cell ring tone can be heard..."JINGLE BELLS." Kelli looks up. CAMERA PUSHES IN as she spots...
From a tiny pinhole in the ceiling, a pale dim hint of bluish light, as if from a cell phone display emits from the hole...
CAMERA CONTINUES IN, but just as she reacts...
BANGS open!
Swings the light toward the door...
A figure stands in the threshold...
WHISKS her weapon down...  90.
The light hits the figure REVEALING Kyle as he lurches back, the fork tearing his jacket sleeve.
Not knowing Kyle, Leigh continues her attack. Not knowing Leigh, he counters, blocking her arm and shoving her back...

Hits the bed, knocking Lauren whose arm slowly falls from its position over her eyes. Leigh looks up just as Lauren's arm clears her face, REVEALING Lauren is, indeed, dead. Her eye sockets are dark and empty; eyes having been removed.
Is up on her feet away from the bed. She turns back toward Kyle wielding her weapon.
Moves toward her...
No! NO!
Leigh hesitates, but remains alert and ready to attack. Likewise, Kyle tenses eyes flashing from Kelli to Leigh. The three stand triangulated; breathing hard, frightened...
There's two bodies in the driveway.
Maybe you did it. He points to Lauren...
Maybe you did that!
No! It's not him! Leigh's eyes dart to Kelli, as does Kyle's.  177 gl.
How do you know? Her back to the hole in the ceiling, assuming they are being watched, Kelli blocks her gesture pointing to the ceiling...
Subtly look up...
CAMERA MOVES PAST KELLI and RISES to the ceiling. The faint light continues glowing from within the ceiling pinhole...
Her "The Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" ringtone SOUNDS. CAMERA INCHES INTO Kelli as she raises the phone with dread... and pushes the "send" button...
They're my family, now. Kelli battles tears, but with a strength derived from anger, she asks in an accusatory whisper...
What have you done... Billy? The call abruptly disconnects. Kelli turns, looks to the ceiling...
The light is out.
Witness the seeping light go out. They look to Kelli...
As CAMERA INCHES TO HER... she whispers.
He's in the attic.
CAMERA IS CREEPING. In the darkness, barely visible... awaits the trap door to the attic.  92.

CAMERA INCHES TOWARD Lauren's door as the three appear in the threshold. Kyle steps out and moves toward the stairs. The girls take a step toward the attic door. Kyle turns to check they are following and sees they are not. In a low scared whisper...
No fucking way!
Clair might be alive. She might be up there.
Eve's not. Heather's not. Ms. Mac.
They all left the house. He couldn't get them in the attic.
I've searched the whole house.
And I've seen under the house. Where else could they be?
Until I see that they're dead... they are alive. He takes Kelli by the arm, for emphasis...
They're not. Kelli pulls her arm away. She gestures to the weapon in Leigh's hand...
There's three of us.
(scoffs) It's fucking Billy Lenz! He's probably watching us, right now...
(cuts him off) If I was alive. I would expect my sister to go up there... Leigh eyes Kelli, impressed, and absently nods.  93.
How would you know? You don't even have a fuckin' sister.
Yeah, she does. Leigh doesn't even check Kelli's reaction as she moves past Kyle and Kelli and starts toward the attic trap door, clutching her weapon. Kelli eyes Kyle...
If you don't think you owe me... you fucking owe Megan... at least, this. He grabs the two of them and with emphasis...

If we go up there... the second we see they're dead... we turn and run the fuck out of this house. Leigh and Kelli consider, then nod. Kyle eyes them for a beat as he reaches into his pocket and removes a butterfly knife. As he flips it open...

head_text.subj: FROM THE POSITION OF THE DOOR

text: FRAME IS EMPTY, seemingly dark, until Leigh steps cautiously INTO FRAME, back against the farthest wall. Only a faint rim of reflecting spill light delineates Leigh, Kelli, and Kyle from the darkness.
CAMERA INCHES TOWARD the trap door...

The three reach the area just beneath the attic door. Leigh nods to Kelli, then takes a step toward the ladder. Kelli's lifts the flashlight, preparing to turn it on... Kyle suddenly reaches out and stops Leigh. She looks at him and without acknowledging her, Kyle moves ahead of her toward the base of the ladder. He turns to Kelli, then mouths and gestures...
I open the door, you hit the light. She nods...
The trap door awaits directly above as Kyle steps on the first rung of the ladder...  94.
CAMERA RISES with Kyle's foot as it steps on the next rung...
Kelli raises it; thumb hovering over the "on" switch.
Grips the barbecue fork, readies...
Kyle rises toward CAMERA, reaching the door. He eyes the girls, then holds out his hand and counts off with his fingers... one... two... three!

He KNOCKS open the door, then takes a defensive step down. Kelli turns on the flashlight. Beat... SILENCE... above Kyle, the flashlight is a tube of illumination on the rafters. Small, one or two inch icicles cling to the leaking ceiling... Kyle turns around and reaches down, gesturing for Kelli's flashlight... Suddenly, a black plastic trash bag is whipped over Kyle's head. His upper body is pulled into the attic...
step forward, reach out, but cannot grab Kyle's legs.
knocked by Kyle's hand, spins rolls...
Begins climbing the ladder, looks up...
The flashlight stops bouncing and spinning, its light stops on... a pair of eyes... framed in a black hood. In a mere glimpse, the most illuminated eye, the left iris... is yellow.
Struggling violently, stabs blindly with his knife as he disappears into the darkness of the attic. The door
Rush toward the ladder...
Extreme elongated shadows are created by the flashlight struggle. The killer straddles Kyle's chest.
Struggling to escape, Kyle's feet are over the attic door. Kicking; pressing against the floor for leverage. His desperate actions prevent Kelli and Leigh from entering...
Push up against the door while it BANG BANG BANGS!
Blinded and choking from the plastic bag. His arms, including the hand holding his butterfly knife, are pinned down by the assailant straddling his chest.
Removes the glass unicorn from a pocket. Raises it...
The light glinting off the horn, is plunged OUT OF FRAME...
O.S., KYLE SCREAMS! Kelli and Leigh intensify their efforts...
Again, plunges the glass dagger toward Kyle's head...
Reacting to the pain... PUSH AGAINST FLOOR and SCUTTLE BACK.
Is bucked, but maintains the advantage...  183 184 96.
Move off of the door...
Push! The door flies open! They hurry up the ladder. Once inside, the attic door teeters, then SLAMS closed!
Kelli and Leigh charge the figure, just as it plunges the pointed horn into the plastic bag. Kyle's body goes limp. They grab the killer, who rears, pushing them deep into the attic.
Fall against the base of a rocking chair, which lurches forward, toward them. They look up...
The face of Leigh's sister remains frozen in horror, wrapped in plastic. Eye sockets, empty. Seated in the chair, the body nearly tips over on them...
FRAME IS EMPTY until she rears back, terrified...
Slips off the plywood covered area and into the rock wool insulation. Her foot CRASHES through the plaster...
One leg falls through the floor to her thigh...
On the floor, scoots on her hands and behind, away from Clair. Kelli looks to Leigh...
struggling to pull herself out, yet the movements cause her to slip further into the hole...
Her eyes flash to Kyle...  97.
The Killer straddles Kyle's motionless body. The Killer rises. Nearly indiscernible in the flashlight, the killer clenches several strands of extracolar muscles attached to Kyle's removed eyeballs.
He's my family, now. The killer grabs Kyle's body by the legs and begins dragging it across the room...
Her eyes flash toward Leigh...
Slips a few more inches into the floor. She looks to Kelli...
Kelli rises to her hands and knees, crawling, quickly, but cautiously across the attic floor toward Leigh...
Tries pulling herself out of the floor. CRACK! She slips further...
As Kelli reaches Leigh and grabs her arms...
Strikes.
Turn toward the light...
Red and silvery; is lit...
CAMERA INCHES IN ON THEM, reacting with horror...  98.
A body, a silhouette in the darkness... until the candle cast an amber glow... REVEALING... Melissa's dead body. The eye sockets are empty and black. O.S., the HUMMING continues...
frightened. Sickened.
Is lit...
The flickering light dances across her dead, expressionless, face. Her eyes have been removed...
CAMERA CONTINUES TOWARD THEM... both frozen and mortified...

In the corner... a display. The sincere intent had been a Currier and Ives family at Christmas print, however, it appears as if sculpted by an insane Gothik/Punk artist. The bodies of the murdered sorority sisters, Megan, Clair, and Melissa are posed, as if exchanging presents, beneath an Evergleam pink aluminum Christmas tree. Seven pairs of actual human eyeballs ornament the tree. A dozen candles illuminate the area. Placed on the floor are sheets of crumpled wrapping paper, ribbon and bows, as if presents have jest been opened. Clair's music box is placed in Megan's hands.

HUMMING Tchaikovsky, turns toward Kelli and Leigh. The yellow, unblinking, unmoving eye, catches some spill light. Then with a tone heard in the phone calls, one that is not not evil or crazed, but rather eerily pathetic with a pleased, happy smile, spoken to Kelli and Leigh... and quoting Melissa...
Everyone should be home for Christmas.  99. The figure starts toward them...
Trembling and rattled, try pulling Leigh from the floor who grasps the wooden supports; strains...
Slips deeper through the plaster.
Approaches...
Suddenly... CRACK! The floor gives way. Collapses! Leigh falls through the floor and into one of the girls's bedroom. Kelli turns, checks the killer's position...
a step away...
Tries to jump through the hole in the floor, but the killer grabs her shoulders. A plastic bag begins whipping over her head, but Kelli raises an arm and blocks it. She lunges forward...
Kelli grabs it...
Rolls, turns, then drives the weapon toward the killer...
The prongs plunge into the yellowed iris. The figure's head is thrown back.
Kelli rears, looking up to the figure...
The hooded head slowly levels. Oddly, the fork remains in the eyeball with no release of blood or fluid. The fork extends out, stuck in the eye.  100.
Reacts, shocked, confused...

A first true look at the face of the figure, albeit in the eerie flickering amber light, REVEALS an unnerving androgyny. Although the face is large and, somewhat, masculine, the lips and nose are feminine. The skin texture appears shiny, plastic-like and sweaty. Thick scar tissue encircles the neck. With no reaction of pain or emotion, the figure reaches up, grabs the fork handle, and with effort, twists the fork and head until the prosthetic eye is pulled from the socket.
remains on the tip of the fork. At this image size, it is clear that the iris has been hand painted or tinted yellow...
The empty socket is black with scar tissue. The head turns, looking at the eye on the end of the fork and REVEALING the surviving right eye is a brilliant bright blue...
CAMERA PUSHES IN, repulsed, frozen with fear and shock. She whispers...
They are not your family... Agnes.
Indeed, the killer, Agnes Lenz, drops the fork...
Although trembling with fear, addresses Agnes...
I am not your family. You're brother is not here.
reacts... doesn't understand. She considers... then, with an eerie child-like smile...  101.
But... my daddy is.

Kelli doesn't understand. Then, suddenly... MUTED... "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" CHIMES from her back pocket. Her expression flashes a hope of possibility... as she hustles toward the attic door while removing her cellphone from her back pocket. She is SCREAMING, PLEADING for help before she manages to engage the phone...
Kelli reaches the door, however...
A hatch lifting ring is inset and flush against the wood. Kelli's trembling fingers struggle to lift the ring.
Approaches...
CAMERA SWEEPS IN AS FROM THE PHONE... the chilling, now familiar voice calmly declares...
You're... my family now. Kelli reacts, stunned and puzzled. Behind her, Agnes whisks a green Hefty trash bag whips over Kelli's head...
GASPS! The plastic vacuums to her face. She stumbles to the floor.
straddles Kelli...
Tears the plastic away...  185 102.
Raises the glass unicorn...
Dekes her head. The glass spike catches a piece of her earlobe as it drives into the floor and breaks off. Kelli grabs Agnes' wrist...
looks at the ornament. Now, a block of glass...
Quickly grabs for the broken glass spike. Grabs it. She plunges her hand upward...

Brings the glass rock downwards, but Kelli's weapon makes impact first, plunging just below the right eye socket. As she rears back, Kelli grabs Agnes' arm with both hands, trying to free the ornament from Agnes' hand.
Knocks the ornament from Agnes' hand...
Knocks over a pair of candles...
Agnes maintains a grasp on Kelli. They fall backwards...
Lands atop a piece of wrapping paper on the ground. It begins burning beneath the flammable tree...
Stumble backward toward the wall and to fall into the space between the walls.
Clutches grabs, trying to break her fall.  186 187 188 189 103.
Tumbles grotesquely all the way to the basement...
Manages to break and stop her fall at some point mid way between the attic and the basement. She breathes hard...
Agnes, from the base of the house begins climbing toward Kelli...
Lies on the floor, disoriented and stunned. She awakens upon HEARING KELLI'S calls for help.
Kelli?
Kelli KNOCKS on the wall, pushes against it.
LEIGH?! LEIGH?! In the wall. I can't move.
Initially, Leigh is confused. Kelli's CRIES, however, can be heard within the wall. Leigh moves to the wall and places her ear against the wood, trying to determine Kelli's position.
Leigh turns and quickly tries to find a heavy object in the darkness...
She stumbles upon a pair of ten pound aerobic dumbbells...
Kelli looks down...  190 191 192 193 104.
Is climbing toward her...
Bangs on the wall... tries to push...
Hearing Leigh's voice, Kelli begins pounding on the wall...
Leigh attempts to discern Kelli's position, listening to the KNOCKING within the wall. Leigh places her ear to the wall for one final check. Leigh rears back with the dumbbell and smashes the wall...
On the floor, near the lip of the wall... rolls with the concussion of the dumbbell impact.
SMASH! Again, until finally, a hole is created...
Looks up...
The interior of the wall is very dark, except for the faint amber glow of the candles high above in the attic. A faint patch of light spills from the hole Leigh created in the wall.
Looks up...
Moves to the wall to look into the hole. Suddenly a male arm flies out of the hole and grabs Leigh, wrapping around her neck and pulling her to the wall
CAMERA SWEEPS IN TO REVEAL BILLY LENZ. His yellow eyes intense as Leigh escaping his grasp.

the wall ERUPTS as Billy's other arm POUNDS through the wall. His hand grab at Leigh's eyes, trying to pull them out. She struggles, battles, then manages to swing the dumbbell up upon the clutching arm.
In the momentary easing of his grasp, pulls away. Holding the dumbbell, she tears out of the room.
Looks down...
Climbs up toward her...
Looks up...
Through the light in the wall, sees another form. It turns within the wall with the ease of a cockroach. In the dim light, Billy's face looks directly toward her...
As he starts toward her...  196 197 198 199 200 106.
Leigh bounds down the stairway and toward the hallway...
CAMERA LEADS Leigh as she opens a door...
Within the walls, muted POUNDING! It appears to be in the other room. Leigh moves on...
Agnes scales the wall, growing closer to Kelli, who tries to move, but cannot.
crawls toward Kelli, below him...

Leigh races to the next door. As she opens it, a form appears to be waiting for her. Leigh SCREAMS! It is the laundry room. Some clothes hang near the door. Leigh brushes them aside and moves to the wall. Kelli's SCREAMS seem to be directly on the other side.
Leigh realizes she does not know Kelli's exact location. Leigh taps the wall, tries to locate Kelli's position...
On reflex, Leigh rears back and swings the dumbbell toward the wall.
A foot from her head, the wall buckles. CRACKS.  201 202 203 204 205 206 207 208
Rocks... rolls toward the discarded wrapping paper. It catches fire.
BAM! The wall buckles again!
Agnes is close enough to reach for it.
out of a nightmare... crab crawls toward her.
BASHES THE WALL! She makes it through the wall. Her intensity increasing, she wildly drives the dumbbell through the wall, increasing the size of the hole.
Ignites the Christmas tree...
Tries to pull at the wood, tearing it away.
Likewise, pulls at the wood, increasing the hole...
Grabs Kelli's foot...
201 202 203 204 205 206 207 208 Leigh reaches into the wall and grabs Kelli. Leigh starts pulling her out...  209 210 211 212 213 214 108.
grabs Kelli's hair. He pulls upward...
Aflame, wilts, melts under the heat. It topples... into the space beneath the walls...
The tree falls toward CAMERA...

With all her remaining strength, Leigh pulls Kelli from the wall, just as Agnes appears from below and Billy, upside down, from above... still within the wall. Billy reaches to get out of the hole just as... Leigh and Kelli fall to the laundry room floor and the hole within the wall erupts with flame!
Race out of the room...
A frame within the wall, is enveloped with flame. As Billy and Agnes SCREAM...

Leigh and Kelli SLAM the door behind them. From the room across the hall, they jamb a chair beneath the doorknob, or obstruct the threshold with a bureau in the hallway. In either case, Billy and Agnes are locked in the room. As Leigh helps Kelli hustle off toward the living room...

From the fallen tree, lies on the floor, dotted with blood and reflecting the angry flames within the wall. As Billy and Agnes continue to SCREAM... OVERLAPPING... a smooth country jazz guitar begins Eddie Arnold's "Santa Claus is Coming to Town..."  215 216 217 109. Through the DISSOLVE... what appear, initially to be Christmas lights, are indeed stobbing red siren lights...
The lights flash and spin, yellow, red and white, from many types of emergency vehicles. Police cars...
Sits atop a nurses' station desk. "Santa Claus is Coming to Town" plays from the intercom.
CAMERA IS MOVING DOWN THE HALLWAY. The hospital is chaotic due to events at Phi Kappa and the ice storm. STAFF, NURSES, DOCTORS and E.M.T.S are crisscrossing the FRAME...

REVEALS Leigh moving down the hallway with a thousand yard stare. Her face displays some small lacerations, which appear to have been treated. She wears her coat and holds an 8x10 manila envelope. She looks up, checks a room number...

This is a two bed hospital room. An ELDERLY MAN sits up in bed as family members gather around the bed, exchanging Christmas presents. The family appears happy and are LAUGHING. In the b.g., the TELEVISION is on LOW... As Leigh enters, however, they turn respectfully quiet, as if aware she was involved in the evening's horrific events. Leigh eyes them, forces a smile and continues across the room.

The foot of a bed is in the F.G. as Leigh appears from the other side of the curtain and holds. CAMERA PULLS BACK as she crosses and sits beside Kelli, who is in the bed, ear is bandaged and appearing sedated.  110. The women look to one another. Leigh lifts her hand, moving it toward Kelli who reaches up and clenches Leigh's hand. Leigh's tone is low as she places the manila envelope on the night table beside Kelli's bed.
Your family will be here in a couple of hours. They're bringing you some clothes. Kelli nods.

These are the things you had on you when they took you to the emergency room. Kelli nods, sighs, then looks to Leigh, who averts her eyes and unconsciously shakes her head. Neither know how to pose the question which, both understand, is unanswerable.
They must have been in the house since he escaped.
We'll never know, Kelli. How could we ever know, now? Kelli averts her eyes. Leigh considers, shrugs.
I think... maybe... they were doing the same thing as me and Clair. Kelli doesn't understand, reacting with denial...

This Christmas... they came back home, looking to find their family. But, you don't need to find them... for the same reason you can't escape them. (without sentiment) They're always there. Kelli averts her eyes. 0.S., in the adjacent cubicle, the television interrupts for a news report about the events at Phi Kappa Sigma, earlier this evening. Kelli and Leigh tense. Leigh reaches into her coat and removes Clair's wrapped present.
I'll never be able to open this in front of my sister. So... I'll open it in front of you. Kelli reaches out holds Leigh's forearm, comforting. As Leigh tears open the present...  111.
Fifteen years after William Edward Lenz's Christmas massacre, horrific tragedy strikes again at the same house. Both appear to ignore the report; their focus on the present.

Details remain sketchy this evening, but Grafton County officials have confirmed that the remains of ten people, eight female and two males, have been found dead at the burned remains of the Phi Kappa Sigma sorority near the campus of Clement University. (beat) Details are sketchy... however, there appears to be confusion in that one a skeletal remains of a male appears to have been buried beneath the house, perhaps for some time... Behind the curtain, the family must hear them crying as they whisper...

Turn that off. They don't want to hear that. The television turns off. The immediate room is silent. In the hallway, Christmas MUSIC plays. It feels eerie. Leigh's eyes fill with tears before the paper is removed revealing a jewelry box. A beautiful watch is inside. Leigh removes the watch, emotional. She turns it over...
An inscription... "Let's make up for lost time."

Leigh begins crying. Kelli sits up and holds her. Then... O.S... a cell ringtone... "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy." It is coming from inside the manila envelope. CAMERA INCHES BACK... then holds as the TONE continues...

Must be my parents. Leigh hands Kelli the manila envelope. She opens it and removes the phone. Kelli freezes as she looks at the caller I.D. display.  218 112. CAMERA SWEEPS IN TO the display... "KYLE AUTRY'S CELL."

Kelli holds the phone in her hand as the "Sugar Plum Fairy" continues RINGING. Leigh's eyes are locked on the phone, also. Both women are so afraid as to appear emotionless... CAMERA PULLS BACK as the RINGTONE continues. There is not a SOUND, except the "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy." CAMERA CONTINUES PULLING BACK, then as if passing through the glass of Kelli's hospital room... is outside, looking into the room.

CAMERA is several stories high, looking through the window, framed with Christmas lights. The phone continues RINGING, HEARD at the volume inside the hospital room. Once outside, the wind WHISTLES... the storm settling. CAMERA now RISES, leaving Kelli and Leigh, still staring at the phone. They CLEAR FRAME as CAMERA CONTINUES TO RISE UP a brick wall until eight plastic illuminated reindeer and a Santa Claus appear on the roof against the dark snowy sky. Seeing when you're sleeping. Knowing... when you're awake.
